headline: ‘John Abraham would feed us, not eat anything himself’: Rohit Roy recalls when he would work out to look ‘bigger than John’
article:
Rohit Roy and John Abraham worked together for the film Mumbai Saga. It was a film directed by filmmaker-producer Sanjay Gupta, who happens to be a close friend of Rohit. In a recent interview, Rohit shared several memories of him with the Dhoom actor. He also shared how he got gym on set to look bigger than John Abraham in the film.

Speaking with Cyrus on his podcast, Rohit Roy said, “When I am shooting, about 12-14 hours of my time is gone there. For times like these, I have a gym in my van all the time. I have it from the time of Swabhiman. It is a regular van, but I have turned one side of it into makeup room and the other side of it is my gym. It is not a full-fledged gym, but it has things that I would need to work out.”
He added, “My last film was with John Abraham, Mumbai Saga. He would not bring the gym on set, he has got a gym at his house so he would make sure to work out and still be on time on set and I used to work out on set because I wanted to look bigger than him in the film. I didn’t want anybody to say that he has got a part in the film because he is friends with Sanjay Gupta.”

He then revealed, “What John told Gupta after we were done shooting is that, ‘I would never say this, but yeh picture toh Rohit ke triceps par chalne wali hai.’ That was quiet a backhanded compliment. He is very funny. You cannot figure out whether he is being serious or joking. He and me would often discuss bikes. He is very smart and witty.”

Their film, however, didn’t do well and most of its scenes including Rohit Roy was never shot due to COVID-19 pandemic.

Recalling another incident from the film sets, Rohit said, “We were shooting for Mumbai Saga. Gupts (Sanjay Gupta) also loves food. There was this another actor, Shaad Randhawa, who owns the restaurant Bayroute. Outstanding food. At this point in time, we were shooting in South Mumbai. So he would say, ‘I have brought food from Bayroute ya, let’s eat.’ Shaad would put a spread, obviously, if John Abraham is called for lunch then… it was all kebabs, hummus, excellent food.”

ALSO READ | Alia Bhatt’s professionalism is ‘shocking’; Salman Khan would workout till 3am, says Ram Kapoor: ‘If you’re not like that, then get out’

But John wouldn’t eat a thing. He said, “John wouldn’t eat a single thing and he would make us eat the whole thing. The first day, I noticed he didn’t eat anything… he did the same on second day. Then I realised, he is calling us for food, feeding us but not eating anything himself. Then he would say, ‘Don’t worry yaar, don’t feel guilty, you have eaten all this food, tomorrow don’t eat carbs.” That was a serious advise.”

Sharing another common thing that he shared with the Housefull actor, Rohit shared, “I have six bikes. That’s another thing I had in common with John. We used to love talking about bikes and I also clean my bike myself.”

Rohit shared he is the owner of two Indians, FTR 1200. “Indian is the first motor bike company in the world.” He also shared he owns a Triumph Rocket. “I have my dream bike, the Java Bobber. I had to buy that and I love it. And I also have an electric bike called the ultra violet EV, which goes from 100 to 160 in under 7 seconds. I never do that.”
summary: In a recent interview, Rohit Roy shared anecdotes from his time working with John Abraham on *Mumbai Saga*. He revealed how he would bring a gym to the set to ensure he looked bigger than John, who preferred working out at home. Despite their friendly rivalry, John jokingly told director Sanjay Gupta that *Mumbai Saga* was "driven by Rohit's triceps." Rohit also recounted how John would invite the crew to eat lavish meals but never ate himself, advising them to skip carbs the next day. Additionally, they bonded over their shared love for bikes, with Rohit owning several, including a Triumph Rocket and an electric bike.

headline: Lyricist Anantha Sriram criticises Prabhas’ Kalki 2898 AD for ‘portraying Karna as superior to Arjuna’: ‘Ashamed to be part of this industry’
article:
Director Nag Ashwin’s epic mythological sci-fi actioner Kalki 2898 AD was one of the biggest hits of 2024 in India, ranking as the second-highest-grossing Indian film of the year. Starring Prabhas, Deepika Padukone, Amitabh Bachchan, Kamal Haasan and Disha Patani, the film fused elements of the Hindu epic Mahabharata with fiction, crafting a distinctive narrative set across multiple eras. While Amitabh Bachchan portrayed Ashwatthama, a warrior from the epic, Prabhas took on dual roles, as Bhairava, a bounty hunter, and Karna, a loyal ally of Duryodhana, the eldest Kaurava.

Now, lyricist-poet Anantha Sriram has come forward criticising the film for its depiction of Karna, claiming it portrayed him as superior to Arjuna. Speaking at a public function organised by Vishwa Hindu Parishad in Andhra Pradesh’s Krishna district last week, Sriram, Hindustan Times reported, alleged that contemporary cinema was “distorting Hindu mythology” and called for a boycott of such films.
Also Read | Alia Bhatt’s professionalism is ‘shocking’; Salman Khan would workout till 3am, says Ram Kapoor: ‘If you’re not like that, then get out’

Alleging that filmmakers were misrepresenting Hindu deities and symbols, Sriram also claimed that he once pledged not to collaborate with a director who rejected the usage “Brahmanda Nayakudu” (a reference to Lord Vishnu) in one of the works he had written. “When they distorted and portrayed Karna as superior to Arjuna, how dare we as a Hindu society stay silent? When Draupadi vastraharan (disrobement) took place, what did Karna do? I am ashamed as a person who belongs to this film industry. We are not going to stay silent anymore,” HT quoted him as saying.

In response, filmmaker Venu Udugula, known for helming movies such as Needi Naadi Oke Katha (2018) and Virata Parvam (2022), pointed out that the humanisation of Karna in Telugu cinema dates back to 1977 with NT Rama Rao’s Daana Veera Soora Karna and questioned whether Sriram’s criticism extended to NTR’s portrayal of Karna. “The matter of Kalki movie aside, in the Telugu cultural narrative, the first film to introduce a social and humanitarian perspective to Karna’s character was Daana Veera Soora Karna. The great NTR brought Karna’s persona closer to the people through this film. Are your comments directed solely at Karna’s character, or do they also attempt to undermine the socially resonant vision that NTR presented? Can your remarks be seen as a rejection of his creative legacy?”
summary: Lyricist Anantha Sriram criticized the film *Kalki 2898 AD* for portraying Karna as superior to Arjuna, claiming it distorts Hindu mythology. He expressed his dissatisfaction with the misrepresentation of Hindu deities in contemporary cinema and called for a boycott. In response, filmmaker Venu Udugula pointed out that the humanization of Karna in Telugu cinema began with NTR’s 1977 film *Daana Veera Soora Karna*, questioning whether Sriram’s criticism also undermined NTR's portrayal.

headline: Diljit Dosanjh could have been at the Oscars, only if Amar Singh Chamkila actually got its due
article:
It was exactly two years ago when the euphoria of ‘Naatu Naatu’ had consumed the West. It almost felt like a scene out of RRR where foreigners were asking each other ‘What’s Naatu?’ yet, dancing to it like they were at a single screen theatre in Hyderabad. The music became bigger than the film and Indian cinema, which proudly boasts about its song and dance culture, had its moment on the global stage. Now, in 2025, India can have its moment again with Payal Kapadia’s All We Imagine As Light. But, while the audience and so-called cinema experts were debating if Laapataa Ladies was the right choice for the Oscars, no one really discussed if Diljit Dosanjh-starrer Amar Singh Chamkila had the potential to be the film that represents India, and this was perhaps a missed opportunity.

The excitement of watching ‘Naatu Naatu’ on the Oscar stage was enough for us to get up at an ungodly hour so imagine the anticipation if Diljit were to perform there. 2024 was undoubtedly the year of Diljit Dosanjh on a global scale. His moment in the international arena started with Coachella in 2023 and continued with his Dilluminati tour in 2024. He sold over 7 lakh tickets around the world and resellers in North America even sold his show’s ticket at a staggering Rs 54 lakh. His shows in India saw people spending abundant money to watch him live in action, and most of them had an unforgettable experience. Diljit knows how to hypnotise a stadium full of fans so they cheer for him, and with him, but he also knows how to sprinkle some magic when he is on screen and that’s what he did with Amar Singh Chamkila.



Diljit’s performance in Amar Singh Chamkila was one of the most mesmerising movie-watching experiences of 2024. And if one were to package this film for an international audience, it had everything going for it. The story of a real-life musician from rural India who survived casteism, riots and communal tension, and managed to achieve the status of Punjab’s Elvis Presley only to be shot by unknown assailants at the age of 27. The story presented by Imtiaz Ali was unlike any conventional biopics that we have seen in mainstream movies and the musical style of the film took it a notch higher than a regular song and dance film. It was the kind of desi experience that shows the culture of India but doesn’t brush the uncomfortable truths under the carpet. The volatile era of the 1980s, the social injustice, and even the hypocrisy of the society; everything finds a place in this musical.

Diljit Dosanjh in Amar Singh ChamkilaDiljit Dosanjh in Amar Singh Chamkila.

ALSO READ | Biopic ‘Amar Singh Chamkila’: Meet the ‘Elvis of Punjab’, who was killed at the age of 27

Amar Singh Chamkila was a Netflix product, which means that the film could have had international representation by a company that is known for its deep pockets, and has a history of pushing non-English content onto the global platforms. A month after this film’s release, Netflix tried to push Heeramandi as the next big thing from India as they hosted its premiere in Los Angeles. A couple of months after the film’s release, Diljit was touring in the US, where he also performed on Jimmy Fallon’s late-night show, which was another historic moment for an Indian artiste. While he was there for his tour, one wonders why Netflix did not seize the opportunity to build him up as a global triple threat who can actually sell packed stadiums. Moreover, they also had AR Rahman on board for this film, who has previously won an Oscar, so they could have positioned it as an Indian musical experience.

It is somewhat shocking that Amar Singh Chamkila wasn’t even on the list of 29 films submitted to the Film Federation of India which finally selects the Indian submission for Oscars. This was the pool that had films like Animal, Kalki 2898 AD and even Chota Bheem And The Curse Of Damyaan, but Amar Singh Chamkila was missing here. Of course, one of the criteria for eligibility for Academy Awards is that the film must have a theatrical release for a week, which wasn’t the case here; but the makers could have made it happen if they positioned the film as a contender for Oscars. If, like Payal Kapadia’s film, this was snubbed by the FFI, they could have still been in the competition independently.

Parineeti Chopra and Diljit Dosanjh in Imtiaz Ali's Amar Singh ChamkilaParineeti Chopra and Diljit Dosanjh in Imtiaz Ali’s Amar Singh Chamkila.

ALSO READ | Diljit Dosanjh’s untold story: Son of a Punjab Roadways driver who cut his first album at 16; brought Punjab to Coachella and the world

In an interview with Film Companion, while promoting Amar Singh Chamkila, Diljit came across as a humble artiste who surrenders himself to his director and doesn’t have an explanation for his process. He implied that he couldn’t write a thesis explaining his preparation for the role, but he could perform with utmost sincerity. He also said that he doesn’t see himself as an actor, but as a musician, and this was perhaps something that pushed him to play Chamkila in a way that it doesn’t even feel like one is watching a performance.

Diljit, and his fans, had a wonderful 2024 and if he was the artiste who was on the Oscars stage representing India, it would have been a cherry on the cake. Perhaps, that’s next on his list!
summary: In 2024, Diljit Dosanjh's *Amar Singh Chamkila* captivated audiences with its portrayal of the real-life musician who overcame casteism and social unrest in rural India. The film, blending music and social commentary, had the potential to represent India at the Oscars, especially with Netflix's backing and AR Rahman involved. Despite its global appeal and Diljit's massive international presence, the film was notably absent from India's Oscar submission list, raising questions about missed opportunities for broader recognition.

headline: Bigg Boss 18’s evicted contestant Kashish Kapoor calls Vivian Dsena and Karanveer Mehra ‘failed products’: ‘Karanveer is far from good’
article:
Reality show artist Kashish Kapoor got evicted from Bigg Boss 18 just two weeks before the grand finale. While the actress is upset over her eviction, she also comes with a lot of anger, especially towards Avinash Mishra and Karanveer Mehra. In an exclusive interview with SCREEN, Kashish slammed the Bigg Boss contestants as well as makers. She also declared that what many labelled as misbehavior with host Salman Khan was not wrong, according to her.

Also Read: Bigg Boss 18: Wildcard contestant Kashish Kapoor exits Salman Khan’s show two weeks before grand finale

Talking about her altercation with Salman Khan and why she apologized to him, Kashish said, “I felt bad after behaving like that with him, the guilt was eating me. Even that day when I was talking I realized that I was being defensive, but it was not because I was being disrespectful but because I was put in a spot. I do understand that a lot of people don’t like it when somebody defends themselves as aggressively as I did. I was not wrong. I felt bad that I spoke to Salman sir like that, he is very senior to me and my body language even though was not wrong, wasn’t liked by him. I respected that sentiment and apologized.”

Agreeing with the popular opinion about Avinash Mishra being toxic, Kashish went on to slam the actor and said, “He is toxic, I knew it from the moment I entered. The way Avinash gets aggressive, he will flip and start saying derogatory things. He argues in a crass manner and has no class. He is very insecure and has a big ego too.”

Recently, it has been mentioned several times that both Vivian Dsena and Karanveer Mehra are leading as audience favorites. It was also said that the two have the potential to be the final contenders for the trophy. When Kashish was asked if they were strong, she said, “Not at all. When a failed product is marketed brilliantly, and you have spent a lot of money on it, everybody talks about the product. When Karanveer was marketed to me I thought he was a sensible guy, but in the house when I met him, I learned that he is far from good.”

Kashish also commented on Chahatt’s affair being discussed on national television, and said that she didn’t expect this from the makers. “Chahatt’s secret relationship is nobody’s concern, it happened outside the show and doesn’t involve any member of the show. I don’t think it was justified, not something I expected would happen on Bigg Boss,” Kashish opined.

Now as the show is in its final leg, Kashish wants to see Rajat Dalal in the top 2, sand deserves to win. Bigg Boss 18’s grand finale is scheduled to happen on 19th January.

Kashish Kapoor calls Karanveer Mehra and Vivian Dsena failed products of Colors TV
summary: Kashish Kapoor, recently evicted from *Bigg Boss 18*, expressed frustration and anger towards fellow contestants Avinash Mishra and Karanveer Mehra, as well as the show's makers. She defended her altercation with host Salman Khan, stating she was not disrespectful but was defensive in a tough situation. Kashish labeled Avinash as toxic and insecure, while criticizing Karanveer and Vivian Dsena as "failed products" of Colors TV, claiming they were heavily marketed despite lacking substance. She also condemned the airing of Chahatt's personal affair, calling it unnecessary. As the finale approaches, she expressed her support for Rajat Dalal to win.

headline: Delhi sees record surge in voter registration amid cash schemes for women
article:
NEW DELHI: The Chief Electoral Office (CEO) in Delhi on Monday reported an 'unprecedented' surge in voter registration forms, with over 5 lakh submissions in the past 20 days.

It is equivalent to the total forms typically received in an entire year. 

CEO officials attributed the spike to the Aam Aadmi Party's Mukhya Mantri Mahila Samman Yojna (MMMSY) which promises Rs 2,100 monthly assistance to registered women voters.

The scheme has garnered significant public attention ever since it was announced by the party recently.

The officials said that they expect the trend to continue as the Congress unveiled a similar scheme earlier in the day while the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is also expected to come out with a Direct Bank Transfer (DBT) scheme. 

Congress on Monday announced 'Pyari Didi Yojana', promising monthly financial assistance of Rs 2,500 to women if voted to power in Delhi.

The announcement was made by Karnataka's Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar, who highlighted the success of similar initiatives in Karnataka. 

The announcement of the 'Pyaari Didi Yojana' by Congress comes as a direct counter to the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP's) Mukhya Mantri Mahila Samman Yojna (MMMSY).

While both AAP and Congress' schemes promise financial assistance for women, the latter has positioned its own initiative as a more robust and immediate solution.

Shivakumar emphasised that the scheme is designed to empower women financially, a vision that has already shown positive results in Karnataka.

"We are confident that the Congress will form the next government in Delhi, and as soon as we take office, the first Cabinet meeting will implement this scheme," he said.

Drawing parallels with the Karnataka model, Shivakumar shared that the Congress government there had brought significant financial relief to families, with savings of Rs 4,000 to Rs 5,000 per month through similar initiatives.

He expressed confidence that such reforms would bring about similar transformations in Delhi, benefiting the city's residents.

The 'Pyaari Didi Yojana' is set to be a cornerstone of Congress's women empowerment agenda, with Delhi Congress chief Devender Yadav promising more such initiatives in the near future. 

Yadav assured the people of Delhi that the party’s approach would be grounded in action, drawing from its successful implementation of similar schemes in states like Karnataka, Telangana, Himachal Pradesh, and Rajasthan.

"Under this scheme, Rs 2,500 will be credited directly to the accounts of Delhi's women every month, benefiting half of the city's population," reiterated Yadav.
The voter registration spree began on December 16 with the poll body receiving 5.1 lakh Form-6 applications since that date. Election officers have been directed to prioritize the scrutiny of all such forms submitted in the past one month.

"This trend of unprecedented increase of form-6 and that too after 20 days of last date of receiving claims and objections is unexpected and needs greater scrutiny," the Delhi's poll body stated.

“This volume, typically seen over a year, has been logged in just three weeks. The timing coincides with the announcement of DBT schemes. There is a possibility of forged documents being used to secure benefits," a senior official said.

"We are conducting 100 per cent field verification to identify eligible applicants. Stringent actions are being taken against those submitting fake documents for voter registration," he added.

Till now, the poll body has lodged eight FIRs against 24 people for submission of false documents to obtain voter ID cards.
summary: The Delhi CEO reported an unprecedented surge in voter registrations, with over 5 lakh forms submitted in 20 days, linked to political parties' financial schemes. AAP's Mukhya Mantri Mahila Samman Yojna and Congress's Pyaari Didi Yojana are driving the spike. The election body is verifying the applications to prevent fraud.

headline: Upasana Konidela shares daughter Klin Kaara’s reaction as she sees dad Ram Charan on screen for the first time. Watch
article:
Following the massive failure of Acharya (2022), Telugu star Ram Charan is all set to make a grand comeback with director S Shankar’s Game Changer. Interestingly, this political action thriller marks Charan’s first movie in a lead role since he and his wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela were blessed with a baby girl, Klin Kaara Konidela, in 2023. While his admirers are excited for his big return, it seems that Charan’s fandom has now gained a new, little member who gets just as excited seeing him on screen as his ardent fans do.

Taking to social media recently, Upasana shared a heartwarming video showing baby Klin Kaara reacting to seeing her father on television for the first time. In the clip, Klin can be seen catching a glimpse of the new Netflix documentary RRR: Behind and Beyond, which offers a behind-the-scenes look at director SS Rajamouli’s epic film (2022) featuring NTR and Ram Charan. When Klin spots her naana (father) on the screen, she reacts with joy, yelling and waving affectionately. In her post, Upasana wrote, “RRR was truly an experience of a lifetime for us in countless ways. Watching her naana for the first time on TV.”
Check out video of Klin Kaara watching her father Ram Charan on screen for the first time here:
Also starring Kiara Advani, Anjali, Samuthirakani, SJ Suryah, Srikanth and Sunil in key roles, Game Changer is Shankar’s first Telugu directorial. Besides Charan, the film’s success is crucial for Shankar as well, since his previous directorial endeavour the Kamal Haasan-starrer Indian 2 (2024), had bombed at the box office. Game Changer is set to hit the screens on January 10.

Despite riding the high of RRR’s global success and sharing the screen with his father, Telugu megastar Chiranjeevi, Ram Charan couldn’t ensure the success of Acharya and it performed very poorly at the box office, earning just Rs 73.5 crore globally against an estimated budget of Rs 140 crore, according to industry tracker Sacnilk. Directed by Koratala Siva, Acharya also featured Pooja Hegde, Sonu Sood and Jisshu Sengupta in key roles.
summary: After the disappointing performance of *Acharya* (2022), Ram Charan is making a highly anticipated comeback with the political action thriller *Game Changer*, directed by S. Shankar. The film marks Charan's first lead role since becoming a father to baby girl Klin Kaara Konidela in 2023. A heartwarming video shared by his wife, Upasana, shows Klin reacting with joy upon seeing her father on screen for the first time in the *RRR: Behind and Beyond* documentary. *Game Changer* is set to release on January 10, and its success is vital not only for Charan but also for Shankar, whose previous film, *Indian 2*, failed at the box office.

headline: Shakti Kapoor reveals Govinda would come at 9 pm for 9 am shoot, now reports half hour early on set: ‘Insecurity kahan pahucha deti hai’
article:
Govinda was a superstar in the 80s and 90s who used to shoot for multiple films in various shifts on the same day. He used to work on about ten projects at the same time, many times making producers wait. He was known for his tardiness, but his stardom was such that his tantrums were always entertained. His dance acumen, acting skills, comic timings are what made him a bankable star of the era. Once when the actor was shooting in Hyderabad, Aamir Khan rushed to witness him act on set. This incident was fondly recalled by Govinda’s co-star Shakti Kapoor during the promotions of Rangeela Babu about five years ago.

Speaking to Bollywood Bubble, Shakti Kapoor shared, “I remember an incident from older days. Govinda and I were shooting for a qawwali scene on stage in Hyderabad. It was a face-off between the both of us. From a distance, I saw someone very short standing in a corner in the crowd. When I looked at him, I felt like I have seen this person somewhere. After a while, I realised it was Aamir Khan.”
He added, “I asked him, ‘Sir, what are you doing here? Someone bring him a chair and tea.’ He said, ‘I have come to see how Govinda manages to lip sync so well and how he manages to give such long shots in one take.’ He then said, ‘I am the biggest fan of Govinda.'”

ALSO READ | After Dhanush, Chandramukhi makers send legal notice to Nayanthara for using clips in Netflix documentary, demand Rs 5 cr: report

When asked what has changed in Govinda over the years, Shakti Kapoor quickly replied, “The one thing that has changed about him over the years is his punctuality. Earlier, he would arrive at 9 pm for a 9 am shift. Now, he arrives at 8:30 am for a 9 a.m. shift.” He added, “Insecurity aadmi ko kaha se kaha pahucha deti hai. (Insecurity changes people). Now he is very professional and entire industry knows it.”

In the same interview, Shakti Kapoor also rooted for his old friend and co-star. He said, “People say now its too late for the actor to make a comeback, I don’t believe it. We have seen people like Amrish Puri starting at 44. Its never too late for an actor or artiste.”

Aamir Khan has often shared his admiration for Govinda. Back in 2010, in an interview with PTI, the Laal Singh Chadha actor shared, “My favourite actor is Govinda. He can really make me laugh. I just love his films. ” He added, “Govinda is one actor who really entertains me. He has got a great comic timing and he is a fine actor.” Sharing his favourite picture of the actor, Aamir said, “I have seen his film Sandwich some 10 to 12 times.”

Meanwhile, he had also made headlines for criticising the actor’s 1993 film Aankhein.
summary: Govinda, a superstar of the 80s and 90s, was known for his exceptional work ethic, shooting multiple films on the same day and often making producers wait due to his tardiness. His co-star, Shakti Kapoor, recalled an incident when Aamir Khan visited a shoot in Hyderabad to watch Govinda's acting and praised his skills, especially his lip-syncing and ability to deliver long shots in one take. Over time, Govinda's punctuality improved, and he became more professional. Shakti also expressed belief that it was never too late for an actor to make a comeback, citing examples like Amrish Puri. Aamir Khan has frequently shared his admiration for Govinda's comic timing and acting, even mentioning that he had watched his film *Sandwich* multiple times.

headline: Shark Tank India 4: Gaurav Taneja reveals why he’s pitching to sharks after claiming he does ‘Rs 1 cr sales in 1 hour’, says ‘if this fails…’
article:
The stage is set for yet another edition of the much-beloved business reality television series Shark Tank India and the teasers released so far suggest that season four, which premieres on January 6, will be even more intense and filled with high-stakes drama than previous seasons. Recently, the show’s makers unveiled another promo video showing social media influencer and entrepreneur Gaurav Taneja, popularly known as Flying Beast, stepping onto the Shark Tank India floor to pitch his fitness brand named Beast Life.

The Shark Tank promo video begins with Vineeta Singh, CEO and co-founder of SUGAR Cosmetics, asking her fellow sharks who the next contestant is, to which Kunal Bahl, co-founder of Snapdeal, responds, “It’s Flying Beast, the influencer.” Surprised, Singh asks, “Gaurav Taneja?! He’s coming?” After Bahl nods in confirmation, the teaser cuts to Taneja entering the stage with a wide smile. “Sharks, these days all founders want to become influencers. Don’t know where they get the urge from,” he says, prompting Vineeta Singh to quip, “And influencers want to become founders!”
Shark Tank India 4: Aman Gupta reacts sharply to entrepreneurs’ claim their headphones outperform boAt’s

Introducing Beast Life, Taneja explains that it is not just a health and supplement brand, but a “healthy way of life.” During the pitch, a person from the company, accompanying Taneja, claims that Beast Life generated Rs 1 crore in sales within just one hour of launching, which stuns the sharks. “That is a dream for a lot of businesses,” Aman Gupta, co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer of electronics brand boAt Lifestyle, points out. Concluding his pitch, Taneja can be seen asking the sharks “Rs 1 crore for 1 per cent of equity.”

Bahl, curious about Taneja’s background, asks, “Generally, IIT-ians go to Google, Facebook etc or go for start-ups. How come your trajectory is different?” As Gupta points out, “These days a lot of influencers are floating brands,” Peyush Bansal, co-founder and CEO of Lenskart, asks, “What is the kind of income an influencer can generate today?” “You earned Rs 1 crore in 1 hour, then what are you doing here asking for Rs 1 crore (for 1 per cent equity),” asks Singh. In response to the questions posed by the sharks, Taneja says, “Just like the ‘Beast’ in the name ‘Beast Life’, my everything is in this. If this fails, I can’t create another one (brand). This is my life.” The promo video concludes on a cliffhanger, leaving viewers wondering if Flying Beast will secure a deal with the sharks.
summary: The teaser for *Shark Tank India* Season 4 reveals an exciting pitch from influencer-entrepreneur Gaurav Taneja, aka Flying Beast, who introduces his fitness brand, Beast Life. Taneja stuns the sharks by revealing that the brand generated Rs 1 crore in sales within an hour of its launch. The sharks, including Vineeta Singh and Aman Gupta, express curiosity about his unconventional path from influencer to founder. Taneja pitches 1% equity for Rs 1 crore, but the promo leaves viewers in suspense, wondering if he'll secure a deal.

headline: Tragedy strikes Game Changer event attended by Ram Charan, Pawan Kalyan: 2 youngsters killed in accident, ex gratia announced
article:
While Allu Arjun continues to face scrutiny over the Sandhya Theatre stampede incident — which claimed the life of a woman and left her son hospitalised with severe injuries during the premiere of Pushpa 2: The Rule — a tragic turn of events marred the pre-release event of his cousin Ram Charan’s upcoming film Game Changer as well. In an unfortunate incident, two youths lost their lives in a road accident while returning home after attending the event in Rajahmundry (officially Rajamahendravaram), Andhra Pradesh, on Saturday. The event was also attended by Charan and Arjun’s uncle, Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and actor “Power Star” Pawan Kalyan.

The victims, identified as Arava Manikantha (23) and Thokada Charan (22), were travelling on a bike when a van collided head-on with their vehicle near Vadisaleru at around 9.30 pm on Saturday, India Today reported. Although they were rushed to Peddapuram Hospital, both succumbed to their injuries. The young men were residents of Kakinada district.
Also Read | Alia Bhatt’s professionalism is ‘shocking’; Salman Khan would workout till 3am, says Ram Kapoor: ‘If you’re not like that, then get out’

Meanwhile, on Monday, Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan announced an ex gratia of Rs 5 lakh to each bereaved family. In a statement released to the media, he expressed his grief over the incident and also criticised the previous state government for neglecting critical infrastructure, specifically the ADB Road, a key route connecting Kakinada and Rajamahendravaram.

“It is deeply saddening to learn about this incident. The deceased, Mr Arava Manikantha and Mr Thokada Charan from Gaigolupadu in Kakinada district were returning home on a two-wheeler on Saturday night. Unfortunately, a speeding vehicle collided with their bike, resulting in their untimely death. I extend my heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families of Mr Manikantha and Mr Charan,” Kalyan said in the official release to the media, news agency PTI reported.

ఏడీబీ రోడ్డుపై ప్రమాదంలో యువకుల మృతి బాధాకరం

కాకినాడ – రాజమహేంద్రవరం నగరాల మధ్య ఉన్న ఏడీబీ రోడ్డు ఛిద్రమైపోయింది. గత అయిదేళ్ళల్లో ఈ రోడ్డు గురించి పట్టించుకోలేదు. పాడైపోయిన ఈ రోడ్డును బాగు చేస్తున్నారు. ఈ దశలో ఏడీబీ రోడ్డుపై చోటు చేసుకున్నా ప్రమాదంలో ఇద్దరు యువకులు దుర్మరణం…

— Pawan Kalyan (@PawanKalyan) January 6, 2025

Heartfelt thanks to the Hon’ble Deputy CM Shri @PawanKalyan garu for gracing the #GameChanger pre-release event held last night in Rajahmundry.

Your unwavering support, kind wishes, and encouragement inspire us to strive for excellence. We are truly grateful from the bottom of… pic.twitter.com/LTlfv9wj4p

— Sri Venkateswara Creations (@SVC_official) January 5, 2025

“On behalf of the Jana Sena Party, we will provide financial assistance of Rs 5 lakh to each of the bereaved families. I have also instructed my office officials to ensure that the government extends adequate support to the families,” he noted.

Kalyan also addressed the road’s condition, stating, “The ADB road is a crucial route for travel between Kakinada and Rajamahendravaram. The previous government neglected the expansion and reconstruction of this road, failing to even carry out basic maintenance work. The coalition government (headed by Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu) has initiated repair and reconstruction works on the ADB road. However, this tragic incident during the repair phase is deeply distressing. It is especially heartbreaking to note that the deceased were returning home from the Game Changer pre-release event when the accident occurred. Ironically, the event had emphasized road safety, urging attendees multiple times to travel safely.”

Watch Ram Charan, Shankar’s Game Changer trailer here:
Meanwhile, Game Changer producer Dil Raju announced financial aid of Rs 10 lakh to the victims’ families. “Producer Dil Raju garu announced Rs 10 lakh and assured support to the families of the two individuals who tragically lost their lives in the accident following the Game Changer event. Our deepest condolences to their loved ones in this difficult time,” read a statement from Sri Venkateswara Creations on their official X (formerly Twitter) account. Directed by S Shankar, Game Changer will hit the screens on January 10.
summary: Tragedy struck after the pre-release event of Ram Charan's *Game Changer* in Rajahmundry when two young men, Arava Manikantha and Thokada Charan, lost their lives in a road accident. They were returning home when a van collided with their bike. The incident occurred on a critical route, the ADB Road, which has been neglected for years. Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan and *Game Changer* producer Dil Raju announced financial aid for the victims' families. Kalyan also criticized the previous government's neglect of road infrastructure and expressed condolences.

headline: After Dhanush, Chandramukhi makers send legal notice to Nayanthara for using clips in Netflix documentary, demand Rs 5 cr: report
article:
Nayanthara’s Netflix documentary made headlines before and after its release when Dhanush slapped the actress and her husband Vignesh Shivan with legal notice, accusing them of using clips from the 2014 film Naanum Rowdy Dhaan without his permission. It became quite big when the actress in turn released a three-page long statement, accusing him of holding a grudge against the couple. Now, after nearly two months, the actress has been slapped with yet another legal notice. This time from the makers of Chandramuki, according to Gulte.

The actress, who marked her acting debut in 2003 with the Malayalam film Manassinakkare, went on to make Vismayathumbathu, and Natturajavu. In 2005, she made her first Tamil film Ayya, followed by Chandramukhi. The film starred actors Rajinikanth and Jyotika. As the documentary, Nayanthara: Beyond The Fairy Tale, explores the actor’s career and love life, it included clips from several of her films from the beginning to her comeback to the latest Jawan.
Now, according to Gulte, the makers of Chandramukhi have sent a legal notice, demanding Rs 5 crore for using a few second clips from the 2005 film.

ALSO READ | Diljit Dosanjh could have been at the Oscars, only if Amar Singh Chamkila actually got its due

Previously, after sharing a statement against Dhanush, the actress had shared another list thanking the people who supported her and cleared NOCs to use clips from their movies. The list along with names like Shah Rukh Khan, and Chiranjeevi, also included the name of her Chandramukhi producer Ramkumar Ganesan, who produced the film under his banner Sivaji Productions. The actress is yet to react to the legal notice.

In November last year, Dhanush sent a legal notice to the actress soon after she released the trailer of her documentary. The legal notice demanded Rs 10 crore for using a three-second BTS clip of the actress and her husband Vignesh Shivan.

Nayanthara slammed the actor for his legal notice and wrote in her statement, “I am in receipt of your legal notice and we shall respond to it befittingly through lawful means. Your refusal to give NOC for use of elements of Naanum Rowdy Dhaan for our Netflix documentary might be justified by you to the courts from copyright angle but I wish to remind you that there is a moral side to it, which has to be defended in the court of God.”
summary: Nayanthara, after facing a legal notice from Dhanush over unauthorized use of clips from *Naanum Rowdy Dhaan* in her Netflix documentary, is now dealing with another legal issue. The makers of *Chandramukhi* have sent her a notice demanding Rs 5 crore for using clips from the 2005 film without permission. Despite receiving support from various film industry figures, including producer Ramkumar Ganesan, Nayanthara has not yet responded to the new legal notice.

headline: Nouran Aly recalls meeting Vivian Dsena during his divorce battle with Vahbiz Dorabzee: ‘She must have gone through a lot too’
article:
Much like his memorable performances in beloved television soap operas such as Pyaar Kii Ye Ek Kahani, Madhubala – Ek Ishq Ek Junoon and Shakti – Astitva Ke Ehsaas Ki, actor Vivian Dsena has also captured hearts as one of the most loved contestants on Bigg Boss 18 and with the show approaching its grand finale, Dsena’s popularity has soared to remarkable levels. In a heartwarming moment, his wife, Egyptian journalist Nouran Aly, recently visited the Bigg Boss 18 house to meet him, sparking a wave of emotion.

Aly also opened up in a new interview about how they first met, fell in love and eventually built a life together. She spoke about Dsena’s first marriage with actor-model Vahbiz Dorabzee as well, and about her own family too. Recalling their first interaction, Aly revealed it began over WhatsApp when she was trying to arrange an interview with him. This led to phone conversations and, eventually, an in-person meeting.



Also Read | Vivian Dsena’s wife Nouran Aly on their interfaith wedding, reveals actor insisted on converting: ‘He said I am doing it for myself’

“He was shooting Shakti at that time, but in my country (Egypt), Madhubala was making a lot of news and was being dubbed in Arabic and shown on one of the biggest channels. So, this channel was supposed to have him over for a meet-and-greet event. As part of this, we were supposed to produce interviews. I sent his then management a message and though they replied, it took a lot of time. Then the event got cancelled due to some issues,” she shared during a chat with Galatta India.

Aly added, “So the interview was pending for my magazine and I kept following it up for three months. After that, I messaged him that ‘people are saying you are an egoistic person and it has come out to be true. It is not good for your fans and when someone respects you for your work, you are supposed to respect them back.’ Then he messaged back saying that he isn’t like that, urging me to understand that he has a very busy schedule. He also assured me that I would get my interview in 24-48 hours and I did. Then I got to know it was like a challenge he had, ‘Who got the guts to talk to me like that?'”

During the conversation, Aly revealed that Dsena was the first to confess his feelings, just a month after they met in person — six months after their aforementioned interview. “He said, ‘I like you a lot and would like to take this ahead, but I have a situation.’ His divorce case was still going on. ‘I cannot commit or promise anything official. But I commit that I really like you and want to take this ahead if you stay with me and have the patience.'”

Discussing Dsena’s divorce, Aly expressed empathy for both parties, acknowledging the emotional toll it must have taken. She said, “Anyone who has been in a relationship for long, emotionally and psychologically involved, it will affect both sides. Vivian doesn’t talk, but I’m really sure that he had gone through a low phase. The other person too… I am not taking this away from her… must have, as a woman, gone through a lot. No divorce is happy; it takes a toll on both sides. If she (Dsena’s first wife) says she had gone through something mentally or psychologically, it is her total right. Society doesn’t spare you if you are a divorced woman.”

ICYMI | Shark Tank India 4: Aman Gupta reacts sharply to entrepreneurs’ claim their headphones outperform boAt’s

Aly also spoke about her own past and how Dsena embraced her family wholeheartedly. “I too am a divorcee. I have two girls, Laila and Alia, who are ten and eight. They study in Bahrain. My family also consists of my father, mother, three sisters and a brother. Vivian helped a lot in filling the gap (emotionally since she had come out of a broken relationship) and healing the part that he was not responsible for. He understood my mindset, where I was coming from and my situation. He accepted my daughters and treated them more than his own. That gives you a lot of security and comfort and helps you trust again,” she added.
summary: Vivian Dsena's wife, Egyptian journalist Nouran Aly, recently shared the story of how they met and built their relationship. They initially connected over WhatsApp when Aly was trying to arrange an interview with him. After some delays, their interaction grew into a deep connection, with Dsena admitting his feelings for her despite going through a divorce. Aly, a divorcee herself with two daughters, praised Dsena for embracing her family and helping her heal emotionally. She also expressed empathy for both parties involved in Dsena's previous marriage.

headline: Scam 1992 actor Paresh Ganatra recalls losing all his savings during Harshad Mehta market crash: ‘My salary was Rs 5,000 in those days’
article:
Paresh Ganatra is known for his comic roles in hit films like Welcome, No Entry, and Scam 1992, among others. The actor, who was last seen in Zakir Khan’s TV show, is known for his iconic dialogues and unique sense of humour. In a recent interview with Digital Commentary on their Youtube channel, Paresh recalled his casting for the role in Anees Bazmee’s Welcome (2007) and how he insisted on working in Scam 1992 The Harshad Mehta Story after losing all his saving during the market crash in 1992.

Recalling what inspired him to work in the Hansal Mehta show, the actor recalled, “I was working then and my salary was Rs 5,000 per month. I had Rs 75,000 in savings and it was a big amount at that time. I lost it all during Harshad Mehta scam. When I found out about Scam 1992, I insisted that I would play this role despite Hansal Mehta saying it was a small role. It was based on RK Damani who is the owner of D Mart and my personal story made me decide that I would definitely play it.”



During the conversation, the actor recalled the time when he got a call from director Anees Bazmee for the role in Welcome. “I had already worked with Anees in No Entry. When Welcome was being shot, my show Baa Bahoo Aur Baby was airing on Star Plus. Anees bhai called and said that there’s an interesting character in the film for you and you will have to come to Dubai on so and so dates for 15 days,” he shared.

Paresh further added, “I told him that my show is going on and I shoot it for 25-27 days in a month. It will be difficult for me, I can’t do it. He tried to convince me but I apologised and said that I won’t be able to do it because this is my prior commitment.”

ALSO READ | 
‘So what if Akshay Kumar reads his lines off a board?’ Nana Patekar defends his Welcome co-star, compares his tricks to Marlon Brando

However, Anees tried to get him on board again after some time, but this time, for a day’s shoot. “After 6 months, he called me again and asked me to come for a one day shoot to Lonavala to shoot just one climax scene and you can’t say no. I just asked him about the dates and went to the shoot at Tiger Point in Lonavala.”

The Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 director is known to give freedom to his actors for improvisation and that’s what happened on the sets of Welcome. “He narrated the climax scene to me and wanted to improvise it. I had thought of a line, which is so iconic now, ‘Mai sirf dikhne mai khatarnaak hu, lekin aadmi bahut acha hu’. I suggested and he agreed to use it for my character,” Paresh elaborated.

In fact, veteran actor Nana Patekar also partook in the final output of the scene. “By then, Nana sir came and asked to start the shoot. When we narrated the whole scene to him, he came up with another improvisation. ‘Mujhe kyun toda, mai illegal nahi tha’. Anees bhai was so happy. Vo scene dhaancha tha and kahan pahuch gaya (It was merely a rough draft and went to another level). As an actor, he gives a lot of freedom to improvise, that’s something really good about him, you don’t get that in many directors,” he ended.
summary: Paresh Ganatra, known for his comedic roles in films like *Welcome* and *No Entry*, shared insights into his career in a recent interview. He revealed that after losing his savings during the 1992 Harshad Mehta scam, he was determined to be part of *Scam 1992* and insisted on playing a role despite it being small. Ganatra also recalled his casting for *Welcome*, where director Anees Bazmee initially struggled to get him on board due to his TV commitments. Eventually, he joined for a one-day shoot, improvising the now-iconic line, "Mai sirf dikhne mai khatarnaak hu, lekin aadmi bahut acha hu," which became a memorable moment in the film.

headline: ‘Entire theatre clapped when Sanjay Kapoor slapped Madhuri Dixit in Raja,’ recalls Indra Kumar: ‘I thought my career was over when his first film flopped’
article:
Sanjay Kapoor marked his acting debut in 1995 with the film Prem. However, the film, also starring Tabu, failed at the box office. Although his next movie, Raja, was scheduled for release three weeks later, due to the poor performance of his debut film, many believed his career was over even before it started. Raja director Indra Kumar believed that his career as a filmmaker too was over, now that his film was going to flop due to Sanjay Kapoor. However, it turned out to be a huge success.

Recalling the incident, Indra Kumar, who had delivered two successful films before Raja, told Siddharth Kannan, “After giving two successful films, I reshot Raja. When I watched the original film, I quiet didn’t understand certain scenes. I realised my mistake, so I rewrote the script and shot it again. That picture too went on to become a super hit.”
Also Read | Lyricist Anantha Sriram criticises Prabhas’ Kalki 2898 AD for ‘portraying Karna as superior to Arjuna’: ‘Ashamed to be part of this industry’

He also added that things were not as smooth as they sound now. He shared, “Just three weeks before the release of Raja, another film of Sanjay Kapoor with Tabu (Prem) had released. But it flopped. People started making fun of me. Even I lost hope. In my mind, I thought, ‘Indra Kumar, consider this your last film. After this, let’s go to Haridwar.'” Explaining his state of mind, Indra Kumar who had just directed the third film of his career, shared, “Now my hero was Sanjay Kapoor, whose previous film flopped so everybody was talking about him. It could have had a bad impact on my film. I lost hope. But, thanks to my stars, and Madhuri Dixit, and Saroj Khan, and my writers, they all saved this film for me.”

Sharing his success moment, the filmmaker said, “When I was watching the movie in Novelty (theatre), the same people who were ridiculing Sanjay Kapoor for his previous film, were clapping for him on the scene where he slaps Madhuri Dixit.” The filmmaker smiled as he shared the incident. He proudly explained, “There is a scene where Madhuri Dixit accuses Sanjay Kapoor’s brother of harassing her, but he slaps her instead and takes his brother’s side. He refuses to believe her. The entire Novelty theatre was clapping. That’s how much power the script holds.”

ALSO READ | Diljit Dosanjh could have been at the Oscars, only if Amar Singh Chamkila actually got its due

The line that Indra Kumar was referring to in his quote was: “Khabardaar jo mere bhai ko pagal kaha aur rahi baat faisle ki toh sun, tujh jaisi 1000 ladkiyan mai qurbaan karta hu apne bhai pe. Samjhi? (Beware anyone who calls my brother mad, and as far as the decision is concerned, listen, I will sacrifice 1000 girls like you for my brother. Understood?)”

Indra Kumar was also a new filmmaker back then who marked his debut with the 1990 film Dil, followed by the 1992 film Beta. Both the films turned out to be commercial hits.

In the same interview, he talked about Sanjay Kapoor not becoming a successful actor. He shared, “Although the film was a great success, it didn’t work in favour of Sanjay Kapoor. I say this to my son too, ‘It doesn’t matter how good you are as an actor, it all depends on your fate and stars. There is a reason certain actors are termed stars. It is because their stars favour them and make them successful. Sanjay Kapoor’s stars were not as powerful. According to me, he did great in movies like Raja. But, it didn’t work for him.”

Sanjay Kapoor got into supporting roles within a decade of his acting career as most of his films flopped at the box office. Eventually, he turned towards production, followed by OTT shows and movies. He reunited with his Raja co-star Madhuri Dixit for the Netflix show, The Fame Game.
summary: Sanjay Kapoor's career took a major turn after his debut film *Prem* flopped, leaving doubts about his future. However, his second film, *Raja*, directed by Indra Kumar, became a huge success despite initial fears of its failure due to Kapoor's previous setback. Kumar credited the film's success to the power of the script and performances, particularly a memorable scene involving Kapoor and Madhuri Dixit. Despite the success of *Raja*, Kapoor's career didn't flourish as expected, with Kumar attributing his lack of long-term success to fate and stars, not talent. Kapoor eventually shifted to supporting roles and production, later working on OTT projects.

headline: Malayalam actor Honey Rose alleges stalking, sexually coloured remarks by unnamed person; one detained
article:
Malayalam actor Honey Rose has come forward alleging that a person, whose identity she chose not to reveal, has been making disparaging remarks about her through innuendos and persistently stalking her. Taking to social media on Sunday, the actor explained that her decision to speak out stemmed from repeated potshot-like queries from people asking whether her silence meant she enjoyed such remarks or agreed with them. Rose also noted that the said person’s sexually coloured remarks against her constituted prima facie criminal offences.

“The said person, as if taking revenge for my refusal to go to the events he invited me to, shows up at other functions I attend and makes derogatory mentions of my name in the media whenever possible. If you ask me whether one can insult any woman using the arrogance of wealth and the legal framework in India provides no protection against this, it is evident that the individual’s actions prima facie constitute offences under the Indian Penal Code, involving making sexually coloured remarks and stalking a woman with such intent,” she wrote on social media.
Don’t Miss | Shark Tank India 4: Aman Gupta reacts sharply to entrepreneurs’ claim their headphones outperform boAt’s

“Personally, I usually dismiss such rants from mentally disturbed persons with both contempt and pity. That does not mean I lack the ability to respond. The definition of one’s personal freedom does not include the liberty to insult another’s personal freedom,” Rose concluded. She later told Asianet News that if the said person continues to do the same, she will initiate legal action.

Meanwhile, a day after the Malayalam actor shared the post, a man has been taken into custody by the Kochi Central Police and at least 30 people have been booked for allegedly posting obscene comments on her social media pages, according to a report by news agency PTI. The case was registered based on a complaint she filed on Sunday night. The accused were charged under various sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), including Section 75 (sexual harassment) and Section 67 (punishment for publishing or transmitting obscene material electronically) of the IT Act. “Interrogation of the person in custody is going on,” a police officer told PTI.

Honey Rose, who began her acting career with director Vinayan’s Boyy Friennd (2005), has featured in films across Malayalam, Tamil, Telugu and Kannada, including Trivandrum Lodge, Hotel California, Thank You, 5 Sundarikal, Daivathinte Swantham Cleetus, Ring Master, 1 by Two, Kanal, Chalakkudykkaran Changathy, Big Brother, Monster, Pattaampoochi, Veera Simha Reddy and Ajantha. Despite being a frequent target of cyberbullying and offensive remarks on social media, this is the first time the actor has publicly addressed the issue so firmly.
summary: Malayalam actor Honey Rose has publicly accused an unnamed individual of making disparaging remarks about her and stalking her with sexually charged comments. She revealed that these actions seemed like revenge after she declined invitations from the person. Rose pointed out that the remarks, which involved sexual harassment and stalking, violate the Indian Penal Code, and she condemned such behavior, asserting that personal freedom does not grant anyone the right to insult others. Following her complaint, a man was arrested, and over 30 individuals were booked for posting obscene comments about her online. Rose, known for her roles in multiple South Indian films, indicated that she would take legal action if the harassment continues.

headline: P. Ramamurti: Communist revolutionary and constitutionalist
article:
The first general election in India after Independence in 1952 saw the emergence of the Communist Party of India (CPI) as the most coherent ideological opposition to the Indian National Congress. Given that the ban on CPI had been lifted only a few months earlier and many of its top leaders continued to be imprisoned, it had little access to electoral finance, relatively little time to reconstruct its organisation for legal functioning, and even less time to mobilise people’s support. Therefore, its electoral success was significant. This was true in terms of the share of both the votes and the seats in Parliament.

The remarkable record of the CPI, during the 1940s, in mobilising people on land reforms, price rise, wages, workers’ rights, and the rights of various linguistic nationalities, contributed to its electoral successes in 1952. In the Madras Presidency, too, the CPI did very well. It was in a position to form a government with its allies but was thwarted from doing so by clever, even if not wholly ethical, political tactics employed by the Congress.

The tallest leader of the CPI legislature party was P. Ramamurti. Although he was only in his 40s PR, as Ramamurti was widely known, had been an active fighter for India’s freedom from his teens. He moved from the Congress to the Congress Socialist Party before joining the CPI in 1934.

Along with P. Jeevanandam, PR played a key role in expanding the communist party’s influence in the Tamil-speaking regions of the Madras Presidency. PR won the Assembly election from the North Madurai constituency even while he was in prison, a reflection of the popular support he and the CPI commanded, by virtue of their dedicated political work.
summary: In India’s 1952 general elections, the Communist Party of India (CPI) emerged as the main ideological opposition to the Congress despite limited resources and recent legal status. Its grassroots work on land reforms and workers’ rights fueled success, especially in Madras, where leaders like P. Ramamurti gained strong public support.

headline: Magnus Carlsen is now married! 5 things to know about the bride- Ella Victoria Malone
article:
Magnus Carlsen, the reigning World Chess Champion, recently tied the knot with Ella Victoria Malone in a picturesque ceremony held at the Holmenkollen Chapel in Oslo on January 4, 2025. The wedding was held at Oslo's iconic 5-star Grand Hotel.

Although Carlsen and Malone were seen publicly together for the first time in February 2024 during the Freestyle Chess GOAT Challenge in GermanyNorwegian newspaper Dagbladet reported that a crew from Netflix was present at Magnus Carlsen's wedding ceremony. The streaming giant is believed to be filming a chess-related television show, which is anticipated to premiere in 2025. However, Dagbladet noted that it has not yet been able to confirm whether the crew was officially assigned to cover the event for Netflix.
summary: Magnus Carlsen, the reigning World Chess Champion, married Ella Victoria Malone in a beautiful ceremony at the Holmenkollen Chapel in Oslo on January 4, 2025. The wedding was held at the iconic 5-star Grand Hotel in Oslo. Carlsen and Malone were first seen together in February 2024 during the Freestyle Chess GOAT Challenge in Germany. According to Norwegian newspaper Dagbladet, a Netflix crew was present at the wedding, possibly filming for a chess-related television show set to premiere in 2025. However, it has not been confirmed whether the crew was officially covering the wedding for Netflix.

headline: South Africa vs Pakistan, 2nd Test: Babar Azam engages in verbal battle after getting hit by Proteas bowler | Watch
article:
Babar Azam engaged in a verbal battle after the Pakistan batter was deliberately hit by South African pacer Wiaan Mulder on Day 4 of the second Test at Cape Town on Monday. The incident took place during Pakistan's second innings.

With the visitors 181/0 in the 32nd over, Mulder bowled a length delivery which Babar played with the straight bat which went to Mulder towards the non-striker's end.

The South African all-rounder threw the ball on his follow-through at Babar, claiming to aim the stumps. The ball hit Babar, who was standing at a distance from the stumps, on his pads. Immediately, Mulder engaged himself in a war of words with Babar.The former Pakistan came down the pitch and said something to Mulder before the umpires and Aiden Markram intervened. Markram was seen having a lengthy conversation with Babar before the matter was sorted.
summary: Babar Azam was involved in a verbal altercation with South African pacer Wiaan Mulder on Day 4 of the second Test in Cape Town. During Pakistan's second innings, Mulder bowled a length delivery that Babar played with a straight bat, and the ball went to Mulder at the non-striker's end. In his follow-through, Mulder threw the ball at Babar, claiming he was aiming for the stumps, but the ball hit Babar on his pads. This led to a war of words between the two, and Babar approached Mulder. The umpires and Aiden Markram intervened, with Markram having a discussion with Babar to calm the situation.

headline: Auckland Open 2025: Sumit Nagal exits in first round after losing to 20-year-old Alex Michelsen
article:
Sumit Nagal's journey at the Auckland Open 2025 came to an early end as the Indian surrendered in front of 20-year-old Alex Michelsen in the first round match on Monday. Qualifying for the main draw after winning two matches in the qualifiers, Nagal took the lead before going down in the next two sets to eventually loose 7-6 (10-8), 4-6, 2-6.

Displaying resilience in the opening set, Nagal saved six set points before winning the first set. However, ranked 41 in the world, Michelsen staged an impressive comeback to level the match.Nagal looked completely off-colour in the third set as the American unleased his dominance and played several well-placed shots to close out the game against 96th ranked Nagal.
summary: Sumit Nagal's run at the Auckland Open 2025 was halted in the first round by 20-year-old Alex Michelsen. After qualifying for the main draw, Nagal took an early lead, winning the first set 7-6 (10-8) after saving six set points. However, Michelsen, ranked 41st in the world, fought back strongly to win the second set 6-4. Nagal struggled in the third set as Michelsen showcased dominance, hitting precise shots to seal the match 2-6, ending Nagal's hopes in the tournament.

headline: Rohit Sharma interview: Ex-cricketer reminds India captain ‘to respect the hierarchy’, says ’playing for India is not…’
article:
Former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar sent a strong message to the current batch of players, stating one has to respect the hierarchy in Indian cricket and can't decide his own 'future'. Manjrekar's comments come in after Rohit Sharma's remarks on retirement in a interview recently during the fifth Test against Australia in Sydney.

The unfiltered interview of Rohit on the final day of the fifth Test created quite a buzz. After making himself unavailable from the Indian playing XI, the captain came out in public to deny all rumours in regards to his retirement and informed that he 'stood down' by himself owing to poor form and largely on Indian team's interest.

Following his barren run with the bat (31 runs in three Tests) in Border-Gavaskar Trophy (BGT) 2024-25, retirement calls got a bit louder for Rohit with legends like Ravi Shastri and Sunil Gavaskar stating they won't be surprised if the Mumbai batter calls it quits in Sydney.
summary: Former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar emphasized respecting the hierarchy in Indian cricket, stating players can't decide their own future. His remarks followed Rohit Sharma's candid interview during the fifth Test against Australia in Sydney, where Rohit dismissed retirement rumors and revealed he "stood down" from the playing XI due to poor form. Rohit's barren run in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy (31 runs in three Tests) intensified retirement speculations, with legends Ravi Shastri and Sunil Gavaskar suggesting they wouldn't be surprised if Rohit announced his retirement. Manjrekar's message comes amidst growing scrutiny over senior players' performances and decision-making in Indian cricket.

headline: Yuvraj Singh’s father takes indirect dig at Gautam Gambhir for Virat Kohli’s struggles in Border-Gavaskar Trophy
article:
Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh's father Yograj Singh blamed head coach Gautam Gambhir indirectly for Virat Kohli's woeful run against the deliveries outside off-stump in the recently-concluded Border Gavaskar Trophy (BGT) against Australia Down Under.

Coming in Australia with a huge reputation, the stylish batter fell trap to the deliveries on the sixth stump and more, eight times in his nine innings against Australia. Baring his 100 not out in the second innings in Perth Test, Kohli managed just 90 runs in remaining eight innings.

Known to speak his heart out, Yograj held Gambhir responsible for not guiding Kohli without naming him, stating the former India opener needed to be less coach and more man-manager at the elite level.Yograj opined that Kohli should have played the balls straight in the Australian tour, something which even legendary Sunil Gavaskar advised during commentary citing Sachin Tendulkar's Sydney 2004 example.
summary:
**Yograj Singh Blames Gautam Gambhir for Kohli's Struggles in BGT**

Yograj Singh, father of Yuvraj Singh, indirectly held India head coach Gautam Gambhir responsible for Virat Kohli's struggles outside off-stump in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia. Kohli, who scored just 90 runs in eight innings (excluding his 100* in Perth), repeatedly fell to deliveries outside the sixth stump.

Yograj criticized Gambhir’s approach, stating he should focus more on man-management than coaching at the elite level. He also emphasized Kohli should have played straighter, echoing Sunil Gavaskar's commentary advice, where he referenced Sachin Tendulkar’s technique during the 2004 Sydney Test.

headline: Neeraj Chopra explains how India can rise in sports, Olympic javelin champion cites USA’s example for improvement
article:
Balancing sports and education is a huge task in India. While a few manage to excel at both, a big percentage of individuals are forced to sacrifice one for the other. In an interview with Lallantop on Sunday, Olympic champion javelin ace Neeraj Chopra opined that it is possible to balance both effectively with proper management.

In a country of more than 1.4 billion, doing well in studies and making a stable career is seen as more lucrative than chasing a career in sports. There are reasons for this, as one needs to enter a proper ecosystem to excel, along with dedication and hard work, to make a name for themselves in any sport.“If you talk about studies and sports, I feel both can be managed equally,” Neeraj Chopra told Lallantop. "The biggest examples are the athletes from the United States of America.
summary:
**Neeraj Chopra on Balancing Sports and Education**  

Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra believes sports and education can be balanced with proper time management and dedication. Speaking to *Lallantop*, he highlighted that in India, education often takes priority due to its perceived stability, while sports demand immense effort and the right ecosystem to succeed. He cited examples of American athletes who manage both effectively, showcasing it is possible to excel in academics and sports simultaneously. Chopra urged Indian youth to adopt a balanced approach, emphasizing that excelling in both fields is achievable with discipline and the right mindset, without needing to sacrifice one for the other.

headline: Payal Kapadia on taking All We Imagine as Light to Golden Globes, no win for film: ‘A very small film made with the struggles’
article:
Filmmaker Payal Kapadia made history after she bagged two nominations at the 82nd Golden Globes Awards for her film, All We Imagine As Light. Payal was nominated for Best Director and her film was in the running for Best Non-English Film category, however, the team missed out on both awards. Yet, seeing her project during many other renowned films Payal Kapadia feels honoured. While at Golden Globes, she spoke about the recognition All We Imagine As Light received.

Also Read: Golden Globes Awards 2025: Payal Kapadia misses Best Director win but shines with historic nomination for All We Imagine As Light

She said, “It’s absolutely incredible, ours is a very small film made with the struggles of a lot of people who put resources into making it. The fact that it is here with all these amazing people makes me feel really happy and honoured.” Payal has been the second Indian filmmaker after Shekhar Kapur who has been nominated for the Golden Globes.

Payal’s film All We Imagine As Light has had quite a glorious run in the festival circuits. The film has bagged awards in several parts of the world including the Cannes Film Festival. Though the film had a limited release in India and also missed out on the opportunity to be India’s official entry to the Oscars, Payal Kapadia’s film surely left a strong impression on the global stage on several occasions.

Watch the trailer of All We Imagine As Light here:
All We Imagine as light stars Kani Kusruti and Divya Prabha in the lead roles. The film is an international co-production between companies from France, India, Netherlands, Luxembourg, and Italy. Other than Kani and Divya, All We Imagine As Light also stars Chhaya Kadam, Anand Sami, and Hridhu Haroon. The film revolves around the life story and struggles of two nurses Prabha and Anu.
summary: Filmmaker Payal Kapadia made history by earning two nominations at the 82nd Golden Globe Awards for her film *All We Imagine As Light*, one for Best Director and another for Best Non-English Film. Though the film did not win in either category, Payal expressed her honor at being recognized among renowned films, calling the achievement incredible for a small film made with significant struggles. Her project had already gained acclaim at international festivals, including Cannes, and despite missing out on being India’s official Oscar entry, it made a strong global impression. The film stars Kani Kusruti and Divya Prabha, and explores the struggles of two nurses, Prabha and Anu.

headline: Yuzvendra Chahal’s old drunk video goes viral amid divorce rumours with Dhanashree Verma
article:

Mint could not independently verify the authenticity of the video. However, there are media reports dating back to April 2023 suggesting that this video was shot after the cricketer returned from Rohit Sharma's birthday party.Notably, the video has gone viral amid what is perceived to be a difficult time for the 34 year old. Chahal and his wife have unfollowed each other on Instagram and the India player has also deleted all pictures with Dhanashree on Instagram.
summary:
**Yuzvendra Chahal Video Sparks Divorce Rumours**  

A video of cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal appearing drunk has resurfaced amid speculation about his divorce from wife Dhanashree Verma. The video, reportedly from 2023 after Rohit Sharma's birthday party, shows Chahal struggling to walk, assisted by a friend. While the authenticity remains unverified, the clip has gone viral during what seems to be a challenging phase for the 34-year-old. Chahal and Dhanashree have unfollowed each other on Instagram, and Chahal has removed all their pictures together, fueling further rumors about their strained relationship.

headline: Ram Kapoor opens up on losing 55 kgs, answers if he used Ozempic or underwent surgery: ‘Does any of that matter?’
article:
Actor Ram Kapoor underwent a drastic transformation recently. In December 2024, the actor announced on social media that he had lost around 42 kgs leaving everyone baffled over his stunning weight loss transformation. Recently, the actor spoke about his weight loss journey and the obstacles that came his way. Ram also gave his views on the dieting industry and pointed out serious flaws with them. During a podcast, he also shared his schedule and routine.

Sharing where it all began, Ram said, “I started about a year and a half back and have managed to lose 55 kgs till now. Initially six months I was doing very well, but then I had a very bad fall, and my shoulder got screwed. I had to undergo surgery, followed by 8 months of physiotherapy. So, everything on the weight loss front stopped, it was those six months and another 6 months after that helped me transform. I never took Ozempic or any other drug for weight loss, neither did I do bariatric surgery, but does any of that matter? However, it is not wrong to do any of that because people do so to become a better version of themselves.”
Also Read: Ram Kapoor shares how he lost ’55 kilograms in 18 months’: ‘I would feel breathless if I took 20 steps, struggled with diabetes and basic movement’

Ram Kapoor further revealed how people accused him of losing weight through surgeries or supplements, he said, “People said that I did bariatric surgery, but then why would I hide it? What I did was, for 5 years before I achieved this I went on a massive weight loss journey and shed 30 kgs, then I put it back on again. This helped me learn what I should not do, then I would stay up all night and read books by experts, and watch podcasts and I figured that there are two kinds of people in this world, one who cares about their fitness and health, and people who don’t.”

Exposing the dieting industry, Ram also pointed out some mistakes people end up making. “The entire dieting industry which is worth more than 20 billion dollars is designed to make you fail, otherwise how will they exist, if you don’t keep going back to them? They will always tell you we will make you lose the weight, but they don’t tell you that you also have to change as a person after that to not put on the weight again. If you see athletes never focus on weight loss, they look at fat percentage, BMI, etc.”

Ram also revealed his schedule and pointed out that strength training and good sleep are key factors. “I now eat twice a day, once at around 10:30 in the morning and then around 6:30 in the evening. Nothing for 8 hours in the middle, or 16 hours after that. Then I do 45 minutes of cardio, and 45 minutes of strength training, and monitor how much liquid you are drinking or sleep you are getting.”

On the work front, Ram has appeared on popular TV shows like Bade Acche Lagte Hai, he was also seen on some OTT shows.
summary: Ram Kapoor recently shared details about his incredible weight loss journey, revealing that he lost 55 kgs over 18 months. He discussed the obstacles he faced, including a severe fall that required surgery and physiotherapy, which halted his progress for several months. He emphasized that he didn't resort to weight loss drugs or surgeries but followed a disciplined routine. Ram criticized the dieting industry, claiming it is designed to make people fail in the long run, as it doesn’t encourage lasting lifestyle changes. His routine includes intermittent fasting, strength training, cardio, and good sleep. On the work front, Ram is known for his roles in popular TV shows like *Bade Acche Lagte Hai* and has appeared in OTT series as well.

headline: Vivian Dsena’s wife Nouran Aly on their interfaith wedding, reveals actor insisted on converting: ‘He said I am doing it for myself’
article:
Actor Vivian Dsena has been a celebrated name in the Indian TV fraternity. Considered among the most popular stars on the medium, Vivian has now appeared on Bigg Boss 18. The actor converted to Islam in 2019 and married Egyptian journalist Nouran Aly in 2022. Recently, Nouran appeared on Bigg Boss 18, after which she opened up about the challenges she and Vivian’s relationship went through initially. In a conversation with Galatta India, Nouran said that she received hate and faced accusations of love jihad when Vivian converted to Islam to marry her. She said she was so concerned about the fallout that she even parted ways with him for six months.

Also Read: Bigg Boss 18: Kamya Panjabi calls Vivian Dsena ‘dull’, Salman Khan says, ‘Your game is over’

Nouran shared, “I was accused of love jihad for converting Vivian to Islam. He also faced trolling on social media, and maybe it affected his work pattern too. We have a lot of differences in terms of belief or language barrier, I had very clearly told him that in my religion, I could not do an interfaith marriage with him, it is not acceptable on my side and I respect that. Vivian was a Christian, and its core is very similar to Islam. But since women don’t convert to our religion, I stayed away for six months because I was very worried and scared wondering if he would do this for me.”

She also added, “I thought the society won’t spare us, if he changed his religion for a woman, secondly, he would regret later if I didn’t meet his expectations. It was a big step. We didn’t speak for six months, and I would not respond to his messages, but then I got to know from a mutual friend that he kept studying my religion. I had zero interference in this, he met people, and then after six months, he told my friends that he wanted to speak with me. He said he was ready to convert, not for me but for himself, so even if I was not with him he would have adopted Islam. It took me 1-2 weeks to believe him that he was doing it for himself, I didn’t want him to be cut off from his roots for me.”

Nouran and Vivian’s love on the show has been adored by the audience. Nouran’s strong personality on Bigg Boss 18 made quite an impression.
summary: Vivian Dsena, a popular Indian TV actor, and his wife, Egyptian journalist Nouran Aly, have been in the spotlight recently, especially after Nouran's appearance on *Bigg Boss 18*. She shared the challenges their relationship faced after Vivian converted to Islam in 2019, including accusations of love jihad and trolling, which affected both their personal lives and Vivian’s work. Nouran revealed that she initially parted ways with him for six months, fearing societal backlash and concerns about Vivian's decision. Eventually, Vivian told her he wanted to convert to Islam for himself, not just for her. Their love story and Nouran’s strong personality on the show have won the admiration of audiences.

headline: Yash’s first poster from Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-ups revealed; check it out
article:
Actor Yash, known for his role in the KGF franchise, is gearing up for his next film Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups. Directed by Geetu Mohandas, the gangster drama features Kiara Advani as the female lead. Now, the makers have unveiled the highly anticipated film’s poster. In the first look, Yash can be seen in a rugged and macho appearance. He is standing behind a vintage car in a dim light background. It is being termed as a pre-look poster to increase anticipation, and the main poster will be revealed on his birthday, January 8, 2025.

The superstar shared the poster on his social media handle and wrote, “Unleashing him…,” showcasing a silhouette of Yash wearing a white tux jacket and a fedora, leaning against a vintage car while blowing smoke rings. The tagline read, “His untamed presence is your existential crisis,” hinting at a dark and enigmatic journey. The poster evokes an intriguing these, with a cryptic message, hinting at a major surprise for fans on 8-1-25, and the time 10:25 AM, promising a sparking narrative.

He shared a note in Kannada and English asking them to avoid extravagant celebrations. It read, “The expression of your love should not be in grand gestures and gatherings. The greatest gift for me is knowing you are safe, setting positive examples, achieving your goals, and spreading joy.”
