Eventually, none of the sharks made an offer, and the entrepreneurs expressed disappointment, with Vineeta calling it "random max."

headline: Irrfan Khan asked Nikkhil Advani not to make Airlift with him, cast Akshay Kumar instead: ‘Mere saath mat kar, you won’t get budget’
article:
Raja Krishna Menon’s 2016 drama Airlift is one of the most celebrated films of Hindi cinema. In fact, it is also considered as one of the best films of actor Akshay Kumar, marking a milestone in his career. However, did you know that Irrfan Khan was supposed to star in the thriller’s lead role initially? On the late actor’s birth anniversary, we go back in time when the film’s producer Nikkhil Advani revealed that he was reluctant to cast the Khiladi actor and wanted to star Irrfan instead. However, the latter believed that the producer might get a bigger budget to make the film if Akshay featured in it.

While talking to Galatta Plus in an interview, Nikkhil recalled the instance and said, “Airlift’s director Raja Menon wanted Irrfan, which was fine for us because he was working on D-Day. I told them I would set up the meeting with Irrfan, and Irrfan overheard me. He told me, ‘Boss, mere sath mat kar ye picture (Don’t do this film with me). It is a fantastic film but don’t do it with me because you will not get the budget. Go to Akshay. You know Akshay.'”
ALSO READ | 
Irrfan Khan asked me to take him to India-Pak border, wanted to fly a kite there, recalls Shashank Arora: ‘The terrified producer said…’

After hearing about Airlift, Akshay was insistent about starring in it and even participated in the several workshops that Raja organised. Nikkhil further added, “So, I went to Akshay with another film, and he called that rubbish. Then I narrated Airlift and told him that Irrfan didn’t want to do it. He asked me, ‘Why have you come to me then?’ I told him, ‘You can’t do it because it is a very serious film and you will have to memorise all the lines, and the director Raja Menon wants to do workshops.’ He told me that he wanted to do it. I told him Raja doesn’t want you, but Akshay did the film. He sat for workshops after workshops.”

Airlift was based on the true events of Iraq’s invasion over Kuwait in August 1990. Akshay Kumar played the role of a callous Indian businessman who became the spokesperson for over 170,000 stranded countrymen. Along with the actor, it also starred Nimrat Kaur, Kumud Mishra, Prakash Belawadi, Inaamulhaq, and Lenaa in pivotal roles. It was praised by the critics and audiences, and was a commercial success.
summary: Irrfan Khan was initially considered for the lead role in *Airlift* (2016), a film that became one of Akshay Kumar's most celebrated performances. However, Irrfan advised the film's producer, Nikkhil Advani, to cast Akshay Kumar instead, believing that Akshay's involvement would secure a bigger budget for the project. When Akshay was approached, he was eager to join, despite being told it was a serious film requiring extensive preparation. He agreed to undergo multiple workshops and ultimately played the role of a businessman who helps evacuate over 170,000 stranded Indians during Iraq's invasion of Kuwait in 1990. The film was a critical and commercial success.

headline: Pushpa 2 Worldwide Box Office Collection Day 33: Allu Arjun’s film trails Dangal by Rs 192 crore; can it catch up?
article:
Pushpa 2 Worldwide Box Office Collection Day 33: The unprecedented success of Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil’s Pushpa 2: The Rule, directed by Sukumar, may be starting to wane as the film completes over a month at the box office. Having already achieved the distinction of becoming the biggest hit in Indian cinema, with a staggering collection of Rs 1,206 crore nett, the film has displaced SS Rajamouli and Prabhas’ Baahubali 2: The Conclusion from the top spot. The latter had collected Rs 1,030 crore back in 2016. Pushpa 2 has also made history by becoming the first film from the South of India to cross the Rs 500 crore mark in Hindi, with its current earnings standing at Rs 791.65 nett crore in Hindi, as per Sacnilk. However, according to the film’s banner — Mythri Movie Makers — the film’s overall gross collection stands at Rs 1,832 crore in 32 days.

What’s notable is that Pushpa 2 was looking to break the box office record of Aamir Khan’s Dangal (2016), which grossed Rs 2,024 crore. With Pushpa 2 still running in theatres, it will be interesting to see if it can indeed break Dangal’s record. As of now, Pushpa 2 is still short of Dangal’s record by Rs 192 crore. However, according to early estimates by Sacnilk, the film’s box office performance has slowed down significantly, with its day 33 collections standing at Rs 2.5 crore, a drastic drop from its Sunday collections of Rs 7 crore. The trade is anticipating a further decline in ticket sales, as the New Year festivities have come to an end and the work week has begun. Nevertheless, the film is expected to experience a resurgence in its collections over the weekend, as no major films are releasing this week, except for Sonu Sood’s Fateh, which has generated minimal buzz.

Also read – Pushpa 2: What worked for Allu Arjun-starrer to stay relevant even after a month of its release?

Despite facing competition from films like Mufasa: The Lion King and Varun Dhawan’s Baby John, Pushpa 2 has demonstrated remarkable resilience at the box office. However, trade experts are cautious about the challenges that lie ahead in January, with the upcoming releases of Akshay Kumar’s Sky Force and Shahid Kapoor-Pooja Hegde’s Deva. The underwhelming performance of Varun Dhawan’s Baby John, which failed to breach the Rs 40 crore mark despite its festive release, has raised eyebrows in the industry. Interestingly, Baby John’s poor showing has had an unintended benefit, allowing Pushpa 2 to maintain its momentum in cinemas, with Unni Mukundan’s Marco also reaping the rewards. As Pushpa 2 continues its run, fans are eagerly anticipating the next installment of the franchise.
summary: *Pushpa 2: The Rule* has made history by becoming the highest-grossing Indian film with Rs 1,206 crore nett, surpassing *Baahubali 2*'s record. The film also achieved the milestone of crossing Rs 500 crore in Hindi earnings. However, its box office collections have started to slow down after over a month of release, with Day 33 earnings of Rs 2.5 crore, significantly lower than its previous Sunday collection. Despite this decline, the film still has the potential to break the global box office record of *Dangal* (Rs 2,024 crore) if it picks up during the weekend. The film faces competition from upcoming releases like *Sky Force* and *Deva*, but its resilience has been notable amidst other films' underperformance. Fans eagerly await the next installment of the franchise.

headline: Even Govinda’s kids ignore his advice; negative influence ruined his bond with David Dhawan, says Sunita Ahuja: ‘He’s stuck in the 90s’
article:
Govinda was one of the most bankable actors of the 90s, with his collaborations with filmmaker David Dhawan resulting in numerous iconic hits like Saajan Chale Sasural, Bade Miyan Chote Miyan, Hero No 1, Raja Babu, and many more. However, their successful partnership eventually fell apart after working together in 18 films. In a recent interaction, Govinda’s wife, Sunita Ahuja, blamed negative influences around the actor for ruining his relationship with David. She also revealed that Govinda is still stuck in the 90s, so much so that even their children don’t take his advice seriously.

Speaking on the YouTube channel Hindi Rush, Sunita said, “I always say David is like my father. Back then, actors used to have a lot of ‘chamchas’, and they would create misunderstandings. People became jealous seeing the partnership between David and Govinda. When you surround yourself with negative people, you’re bound to absorb their negativity.”
Sunita defended David Dhawan and said the filmmaker had never said anything wrong to Govinda but only advised him to adapt to changing times. “David didn’t say anything wrong. He said that in the 90s, solo-hero films worked, but that’s no longer the case. Rarely do they succeed today. David suggested that Govinda take up second-lead roles, but not insignificant ones. After all, he played a second lead in Bade Miyan Chote Miyan, and that wasn’t a bad choice. But people around Govinda would provoke him, saying, ‘You’re the hero.’ It makes me angry to see how these things happened. The people in Govinda’s circle weren’t good; they instigated him against.”

Addressing Govinda’s recent announcement about making a comeback, which he revealed on The Great Indian Kapil Show, Sunita shared her mixed feelings. “I think he has made some announcement about doing three films,” she said uncertainly. However, she added that she prefers to withhold her opinion until she hears more about the projects. “I say it on the face good or bad, I am not going to do chamchagiri whether you are my husband or Govinda. I am not ‘Waah waah’ production, I’m ‘sahi sahi’ production,” she said.

Sunita also opened up about their son Yashvardan Ahuja, who is set to make his Bollywood debut in 2025, and how he doesn’t follow Govinda’s career advice. “Nobody listens to Govinda’s advice because it’s stuck in the 90s. I give advice suited to 2024. We keep telling Govinda to move on from the 90s.”
summary: Govinda's wife, Sunita Ahuja, recently discussed the decline of the actor's successful partnership with filmmaker David Dhawan, blaming negative influences around Govinda for the rift. She defended Dhawan, stating that his advice to adapt to changing times was misunderstood. Sunita also revealed that Govinda's advice is not taken seriously by their children, as he is still stuck in the 90s. Despite Govinda's announcement about a film comeback, she expressed mixed feelings, stating she prefers to reserve judgment until more details are known. Sunita also shared her son Yashvardan Ahuja's decision to pursue his own path in Bollywood.

headline: Chandrachur Singh refused to back out when he heard Salman Khan was replacing him in Kya Kehna, recalls Ramesh Taurani
article:
Kya Kehna (2000) was a significant film in Preity Zinta’s career as it established her as one of the most promising leading ladies of her time but the movie faced many hurdles when it was being made. In a recent interview, producer Ramesh Taurani revealed that distributors were not keen on buying the film as it had relatively smaller stars – Saif Ali Khan and Chandrachur Singh. Ramesh said that at one point, he requested Chandrachur to leave the movie so he could cast Salman in his place. Salman agreed even without hearing the script, but then Chandrachur refused to leave the project.

Talking to Radio Nasha Official, Ramesh said that they initially cast Mukul Dev and Chandrachur Singh but Mukul did not show up on the first day of the shoot, so casting Saif Ali Khan was a last minute decision. He said that this film was being made shortly after the assassination of Gulshan Kumar so they had to get the distributors in place to sell the film in an unpredictable market. At this point, Ramesh asked Chandrachur to drop out of the movie so they could cast Salman instead. “I spoke to Chandrachur and I told him that we can’t sell the film. We asked him to drop out of this film so we can sell it. We were in a dire situation and we had never done something like this,” he recalled.
Chandrachur agreed and subsequently, Taurani spoke to Salman Khan, who instantly agreed to be a part of the movie. “He said I don’t even want to listen to the plot. I will do it just because you have asked me to. But you have to get a letter of consent from Chandrachur. I don’t want to take something that belongs to someone else, something that’s cursed,” he said.

ALSO READ | Angry Shark Tank India pitcher tells Anupam Mittal to stop making ‘befaltu excuses’ if he doesn’t want to invest, advises Peyush Bansal

Ramesh Taurani said that soon after this conversation, the news somehow got leaked to the press and by this time, Chandrachur Singh decided that he did not want to back out of this project as he believed that it would be foolish to back out of a Tips production. Salman then asked Taurani to finish the project with Chandrachur.

The film was a hit at the time and got Chandrachur a few nominations as well.
summary: *Kya Kehna* (2000), pivotal for Preity Zinta’s career, faced casting hurdles due to its lesser-known stars, Saif Ali Khan and Chandrachur Singh. Producer Ramesh Taurani sought to replace Chandrachur with Salman Khan to secure distributors, but after initial consent, Chandrachur changed his mind, and Salman advised Taurani to proceed with him. The film eventually became a hit, earning Chandrachur critical recognition.

headline: Angry Shark Tank India pitcher tells Anupam Mittal to stop making ‘befaltu excuses’ if he doesn’t want to invest, advises Peyush Bansal
article:
The fourth season of the reality show Shark Tank India began with some dramatic new pitches. The first episode saw entrepreneur Gauri Varma from Delhi pitch her confectionary brand, Confect, to the panel of ‘sharks’, which included Peyush Bansal, Anupam Mittal, Namita Thapar, Vineeta Singh and Aman Gupta. Gauri asked for Rs 1 crore in exchange of 1% equity, putting the valuation of her brand at Rs 100 crore. The pitch ended in an argument between Anupam and Namita, who were divided over Gauri’s honesty.

Gauri said that she first got the idea to enter the cakes business after eloping with her husband and getting married in Las Vegas. She said that they spent Rs 36,000 on their wedding cake, which turned out to be an eyesore. Over the next few years, she learned everything that she could about food technology, and started creating fondants and sprinkles. She expanded her business further, and her range of products eventually grew to 800. “This is a big mistake, by the way,” said Peyush, advising Gauri to focus on perfecting fondants before spreading herself too thin. Gauri didn’t seem to appreciate the feedback.
Also read – Gaurav Taneja stuns Shark Tank India judges with claims that he made sales worth Rs 1 crore in an hour, Aman Gupta says, ‘That’s a dream’

Anupam, on the other hand, was struck by something she said in the pitch. Gauri had admitted that she begins to feel restless every few years, after which she develops an itch to start something new. Anupam said that it is her ‘fitrat (nature)’ to get restless, and this makes him uneasy about betting on her. His biggest point of contention was Gauri’s decision to abandon her business in India and pivot to the United States. She said that in just 18 months, her US sales have hit Rs 8.5 crore, and that she intends to branch out in new countries with a round of investment.

Aman was also uncertain. He said that she quickly moved away from the Indian market at the first sign of trouble. “Where will you run away to when you sense trouble in the US?” he asked. Because Gauri was so keen to focus on the US market, Namita said that she would make her an offer on the condition that she balance her business, and devote equal attention to India. She offered Gauri Rs 1 crore for 2% equity, and asked for royalty until she makes her Rs 1 crore back. Despite her initial valuation being halved, Gauri gladly accepted the offer.

Anupam was stunned. He pointed out how easily she flipped on everything that she had said in her pitch. But Namita defended her, and said that she needn’t pay attention to him, especially since she had cracked a deal. “Your superpower has a dark side that doesn’t let you learn from failures, and that can hold you back,” Vineeta told Gauri as she left. In her post-pitch piece-to-camera, Gauri didn’t seem pleased with how she was treated, especially by Peyush and Anupam. “Ab ho rahi hai na FOMO?” she said about Anupam. “Felt like telling Peyush he should sell just one design at Lenskart,” she said. “They don’t understand the first thing about cakes, befaltu ke excuses mat do,” she added, noting that the ‘sharks’ should’ve simply said that they are not interested in making a deal, instead of giving her worthless advice.
summary: In *Shark Tank India* Season 4, Gauri Varma pitched her confectionary brand Confect, seeking Rs 1 crore for 1% equity. Despite concerns from the sharks about her quick pivots and focus on the US market, Namita Thapar offered Rs 1 crore for 2% equity, which Gauri accepted. The pitch ended with tension as Gauri felt the sharks' advice was unhelpful and criticized them for not directly rejecting her offer.

headline: Ram Kapoor had to ‘become Prachi Desai’s legal guardian’ during Kasamh Se shoot to enter Dubai: ‘I had a 17-year-old heroine opposite me’
article:
After making headlines for his stunning body transformation, Ram Kapoor has, for the first time, opened up about his experience of working with Prachi Desai in the Zee TV show Kasamh Se (2006), where he played the lead role opposite a 17-year-old Prachi. Ram was in his 30s then. In a recent conversation, Ram revealed his thoughts on the significant age gap between him and his co-star, and whether he felt awkward about it.

“I was the main lead, I was the hero and I had a 17-year-old opposite me, what is the problem? The story was such! She was 17 when she started working. When we went to Dubai for shooting I had to sign a form and become her legal guardian to enter the country. But the story was such and I trusted Ekta (Kapoor, the maker of the show). I trusted her casting. At that time she (Prachi) was totally new but look at how fantastic she was in Kasamh Se,” he said in an interview with Siddharth Kannan.
Ram also shared his thoughts on the apprehensions that come with being an actor. “How can you have apprehensions if you want to be an actor? Otherwise you become a dhobi and wash clothes! You want to be an actor! That means you want to do anything and everything. You want to do roles 20 years older, you want to do roles younger… you want to work with children… How can you have (apprehensions)? Are you an actor or not?” he exclaimed.

Ram revealed that he is still in touch with Prachi, affectionately referring to her as “Bacchi hai meri (She is like my child)”. He shared, “Bilkool. Bacchi hai meri. Recently, about a year or so back, we met up and also shared a picture on Instagram.”

When questioned about Prachi’s career trajectory, which seemed to stall despite her promising start as a TV actress, Ram offered his insights. “I don’t know. She is another person who left television for films. But she left it for the right film because she left Kasamh Se for Rock On (2008) opposite Farhan Akhtar. Rock On became a hit. Nobody at that time… I could not point a finger at her and ask, ‘Prachi, what are you doing?’ Yes we had a superhit show but Rock On is a Farhan Akhtar film and she is playing his wife, opposite him. So it wasn’t a secondary role. So technically she didn’t do anything wrong. After that I don’t know what she did or didn’t do. You have to make the right choices. If you are lucky enough to get work then you have to make the right choices. If you make one wrong choice, maybe you are lucky enough to get a second chance. Make two wrong choices, ‘bye bye.’”
summary: Ram Kapoor recently discussed his experience working with a 17-year-old Prachi Desai on the TV show *Kasamh Se* (2006), where he was in his 30s. He shared that despite the significant age gap, there was no awkwardness, as the story justified the casting. Ram also praised Prachi's acting talent and revealed they are still in touch. He reflected on her career choices, supporting her decision to leave television for the successful film *Rock On* (2008), but noted that career success relies on making the right choices.

headline: Payal Kapadia reacts to All We Imagine As Light’s loss at Golden Globes 2025: ‘We didn’t win but had so much fun’
article:
Payal Kapadia’s All We Imagine As Light has been making waves globally since last year, especially after its world premiere at the main competition of the 77th Cannes Film Festival last year, where it won the Grand Prix award. It was the first film from India to compete in the main competition since Swaham in 1994. However, it was a disappointing moment for all the cinema lovers when the film didn’t bag an award at the Golden Globes recently, after securing two nominations, including in the Best Director and the Best Non-English film category. Now, the filmmaker has reacted to the loss.

Taking to her Instagram handle, Payal shared her first reaction to the same, taking the snub in her stride. Sharing a mirror selfie with All We Imagine As Light producers Thomas Hakim, Julien Graff, and Ranabir Das, on her Instagram Stories, she wrote, “We didn’t win anything but had so much fun.” She also gave a special shout-out to the designers who helped with her look in a jumpsuit. She thanked them for making her feel confident with their styling. Evidently, the director didn’t leave with a heavy heart and only expressed gratitude for the opportunity.
ALSO READ | 
Golden Globes Awards 2025: Payal Kapadia misses Best Director win but shines with historic nomination for All We Imagine As Light

Check out her Instagram Story:

Payal Kapadia didn't win at the 82nd Golden GlobesPayal Kapadia’s Instagram Story (Photo: Payal Kapadia/Instagram)

At the 82nd Golden Globes, it was nominated in two categories – Best Non-English Language Motion Picture award and Best Director for Payal. The Golden Globes went to Emilia Perez and Brady Corbet for The Brutalist, respectively. Her nomination will always remain a major feat for Indian cinema. For the unknown, Payal was the second Indian director to be nominated at the Golden Globes after Shekhar Kapur, who was there for the English film Elizabeth.

Meanwhile, All We Imagine As Light was first released in India on September 21, 2024, and later in November 2024. The film stars Kani Kusruti, Divya Prabha, Chhaya Kadam, and Hridhu Haroon. It is an International co-production between companies from France, India, Netherlands, Luxembourg, and Italy. It shows the story of three working women, struggling in the metropolitan city of Mumbai, and is currently streaming on Disney + Hotstar.
summary: Payal Kapadia’s film *All We Imagine As Light*, which had a remarkable world premiere at the 77th Cannes Film Festival and won the Grand Prix, recently faced disappointment at the Golden Globes, where it did not win despite two nominations. Kapadia took the loss graciously, sharing a positive reaction on Instagram, thanking her team and expressing gratitude for the experience. Although it didn’t win, her nomination remains a significant achievement for Indian cinema. The film, which explores the lives of three working women in Mumbai, is now streaming on Disney+ Hotstar.

headline: Rohit Roy recalls attending alcohol party in dry city Ahmedabad; says wife Manasi shoots daggers at him after he gets drunk on a night out
article:
Actor Rohit Roy is one of those celebrities who take their physical appearance and health very seriously. As a result, even in his mid-50s, he remains as fit as ever. Recently, Rohit shared a personal anecdote that reaffirmed his pride in his disciplined lifestyle, recalling an experience in Ahmedabad where he encountered some old friends who were drunk, despite Gujarat being a dry state.

“My daughter told me, ‘Baba, you should be proud of how you look and tell them your real age. I used to hide it before,” he shared during a recent appearance on the Cyrus Says podcast. “I went for a reunion in Ahmedabad recently. I walked in not knowing what I was going to see: it had been 25-30 years. I stepped into a basement (at a friend’s place) with a half-km-long bar, in Ahmedabad where daaru (alcohol) is not allowed! I noticed that they all looked 70: somebody was bald, and somebody was fat. I love you guys, but still… Then we took a picture which I have at home and that keeps inspiring me,” he added.
Also Read | Rohit Roy recalls surprising daughter Kiara who is studying at Brown University in USA: ‘I travelled for 20 hours… she started crying’

During the chat, host and comedian Cyrus Broacha also shared how he embraced sobriety and his journey since then. “I don’t know anyone who is as obsessed as me with weight training. I don’t touch alcohol anymore either,” he said, prompting Rohit to ask about the decision. Cyrus revealed he quit alcohol on December 24, 2015.

“I got smashed on Christmas eve and ended up dancing with some stranger woman. My daughter was growing up and she said ‘Dad, stop it now. You coming drunk and mom locking you out of the room.’ What was charming in my 20s and 30s became ugly in my 40s and 50s,” he mentioned.

ICYMI | ‘John Abraham would feed us, not eat anything himself’: Rohit Roy recalls when he would work out to look ‘bigger than John’

Cyrus then went one step further and made some distasteful remarks, almost suggesting that violence against women is a matter of pride as long as they are good-looking. Joking about the ‘consequences’ of drinking at an older age, he said, “You also end up chasing ugly women. I am not against chasing women, but don’t chase ugly women. People would say, ‘he’s in jail for molesting a really ugly woman.’ It’s horrible,” he ‘quipped’, drawing laughter from Rohit.

Sharing the reaction he often gets from his wife, actor Manasi Joshi Roy, Rohit said, “It has never happened that I have come back home after a nice happy evening with my boys and not get dagger looks from Manasi. I ask her, ‘What is it? Is it my health concern or are you just unhappy that I am happy?’ It has to be the latter because my health is fine. I drink once in a while. I don’t drink in Bombay, I only drink when travelling.”
summary: Actor Rohit Roy, known for his disciplined lifestyle, shared a recent experience in Ahmedabad where he met old friends who appeared much older due to their unhealthy habits. He recalled how his daughter encouraged him to embrace his age and take pride in his fitness. During a conversation on the *Cyrus Says* podcast, Rohit discussed his commitment to staying fit, while also touching on Cyrus Broacha's decision to quit alcohol after reflecting on the negative impact of his past drinking. Rohit also shared humorous insights about his wife’s reaction to his social outings.

headline: Ram Kapoor worked at Starbucks after ‘rich dad’ severed ties with him; they didn’t speak for 10 years: ‘I wanted to act’
article:
Ram Kapoor, one of the highest-paid television actors in India and a notable presence in the film industry, recently took a trip down memory lane and reflected on his formative years, growing up as the son of late Anil Kapoor, a renowned ad guru and a wealthy businessman, enjoying many privileges. He also recalled how his decision to pursue acting strained his relationship with his father, leading to a rift that lasted nearly a decade.

“I was a rich man’s only son and I grew up with a lot of privileges. But after school, I told him I didn’t want to run his company and that I wanted to make it on my own. So, I walked away from all those privileges to create my own path, which took me almost 10 years before I started getting regular work,” Kapoor said during a chat with Siddharth Kannan.
Also Read | Alia Bhatt’s professionalism is ‘shocking’; Salman Khan would workout till 3am, says Ram Kapoor: ‘If you’re not like that, then get out’

Kapoor shared that his interest in acting began during his teenage years, but his father did not take him seriously. “When I was 13-14, I told him I wanted to become an actor. He didn’t take me seriously, particularly since I was a little kid and he was a very big man. For him, his company was his legacy and everything and he wanted his only son to take it forward. So, when I said I didn’t want to take over his company, I understood what he must have gone through. Then I fled to America and joined the acting school of my choice. I graduated somehow, returned to India and started meeting people (for work). I had to prove, not only to my father but, to my entire family that I was going to do this. I knew everyone was waiting for me to fail because they thought that would bring me back to the ‘right track’,” he said.

Kapoor revealed that his father finally recognised his success when his employees began approaching him for photographs with the actor. “It took 10 years… Then the time came when people in his own office started approaching him asking their boss for photographs with his son. That’s when dad realised I had become something and that I wouldn’t return (to run the company). For 10 years, we didn’t speak much and then he slowly developed a respect for me. After he passed away, four years ago, I got to know from his partners, friends etc how much he respected me.”

Only in SCREEN | Bigg Boss 18’s evicted contestant Kashish Kapoor calls Vivian Dsena and Karanveer Mehra ‘failed products’: ‘Karanveer is far from good’

Emphasising that accomplishments earned through struggle and hard work hold greater value, Kapoor also shared a personal anecdote about how his father initially believed he had fled to the US for only a few weeks. “He stopped talking to me and sending me money. I was in America on my own, making money for food and rent. I worked at Starbucks, sold second-hand vehicles etc. But, had that not happened, I wouldn’t have been the man I am today,” he added.
summary: Ram Kapoor recently opened up about his early struggles, recalling how he grew up privileged as the son of the late Anil Kapoor, a successful ad guru and businessman. However, his decision to pursue acting instead of taking over the family business caused a rift with his father for nearly a decade. Kapoor moved to America to attend acting school, facing hardship to prove himself. It wasn't until his father saw people asking for his autograph that he finally acknowledged his success. Kapoor reflects that the struggles he faced shaped his character, ultimately earning his father's respect before his passing.

headline: Former Bigg Boss contestant Sana Khan welcomes second baby with husband Mufti Anas Saiyad: ‘Happy Parents’
article:
Bigg Boss fame Sana Khan and her husband Mufti Anas Saiyad have been blessed with their second child, a baby boy. The former actor took to social media to share the news, posting a heartwarming video announcement on her Instagram account.

The video revealed that the couple’s little boy was born on January 5, 2025. “We are overjoyed to share the beautiful news of the arrival of our little prince! Alhamdulillah for everything we have. Alhamdulillah for everything e had. It’s a Boy! Overflowing with joy, Big brother Tariq Jamil welcomes his baby brother! Born on 5th January 2025,” read the announcement post.
Sana’s caption reads: Allah Taala Ne Har Chiz Mukaddar Me Likhe Hai Waqt Aane Par Allah Usko Atta Karta He Aur Jab Atta Karta He To Jholiya Khushiyon Se Bhar Deta Hai. Happy Parents ♥️♥️♥️.” (Translation: “Everything is written in destiny by Allah, when the time comes, Allah grants it, and when He grants it, He fills the heart with joys.”)

The news was met with an outpouring of congratulatory messages from friends and fans. Arbaaz Khan’s wife Sshrua Khan wrote, “Alhamdulillah ♥️.” Anas too took to Instagram to share the good news which received a lot of love from his followers. One person wrote, “Mashaallah 🥰,” yet another person commented, “Congratulations @sanakhaan21 I’m so so happy for u .. may Allah tala protect u n ur family Aameen❤️❤️❤️.”

Sana Khan and Mufti Anas Saiyad tied the knot on November 21, 2020, in Surat, Gujarat. They welcomed their first child, Saiyad Tariq Jamil, on July 5, 2023. Sana Khan rose to fame with her stint in Salman Khan’s TV reality show Bigg Boss 6 in 2012 and went on to appear in several films and reality shows. In October 2020, she announced her decision to step away from the entertainment industry, citing her desire to “serve humanity and follow the order of her Creator”.
summary: Sana Khan, former *Bigg Boss* contestant, and her husband Mufti Anas Saiyad have welcomed their second child, a baby boy, born on January 5, 2025. Sana shared the joyful news on social media with a heartfelt video, expressing gratitude to Allah. The couple’s first child, Tariq Jamil, was born in July 2023. The announcement received warm wishes from friends and fans, including Arbaaz Khan’s wife Sshrua Khan. Sana, who left the entertainment industry in 2020, had married Anas in November 2020.

headline: ‘Phenk mat’: Abhijeet claims he suggested Shah Rukh Khan’s singing portion in ‘I Am The Best’ song, Lalit Pandit declares it was SRK’s idea
article:
Shah Rukh Khan has had many memorable songs in his nearly 33 year long film career and many of his songs in the 1990s were crooned by singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya. During a recent episode of Indian Idol, singer Abhijeet claimed that while recording the song “I Am The Best” for Phir Bhi Dil Hai Hindustani, he came up with the idea that Shah Rukh should himself record the last bit of the song where he sings “Oh yes yes, sing it again.” As soon as Abhijeet claimed this as his idea, composer Lalit Pandit, who was also present on the show, said that this was actually Shah Rukh’s idea as he was present during the recording.

During the episode, Abhijeet performed the song with one of the contestants and then shared, “When we were recording it, I did a portion on top of the chorus where I said ‘Oh yeah, I am the best.’ Then I suggested to Lalit that Shah Rukh should do it. And within one hour, Shah Rukh was there and he did it.” Lalit laughed as soon as he heard this and said, “He has reversed the story now.”
Lalit Pandit, who composed the song with his brother Jatin Pandit, said that Shah Rukh Khan was present at the recording and insisted that he remembered each and every bit about recording his songs. Abhijeet was mildly offended by this and asked, “Maine phenka? (Did I lie?)” Lalit said that he was sharing the conversation that Shah Rukh had with him during the recording and Abhijeet, meanwhile, kept repeating, “It’s very embarrassing.”

Lalit then recalled that Shah Rukh wanted something extra in the last bit and after multiple attempts by Abhijeet, he offered to do it himself and did it in one take. “Shah Rukh kept saying ask him to do it in a certain way. Do you remember we had some problem in ‘I am the best’ portion? We kept rehearsing it more and more. Then Shah Rukh said ‘I will only do this last bit.’ So I said, ‘Yes please, go and do it’ and he did it in one take. He knew the style he wanted it in so it was simple for him. I guess, so he did it in one take,” he recalled.

As Abhijeet kept repeatedly asking if he was lying, Lalit laughed him off and said, “Yaar main baitha hu, tab toh mat phenk (Don’t lie when I am sitting right here).”

ALSO READ | Angry Shark Tank India pitcher tells Anupam Mittal to stop making ‘befaltu excuses’ if he doesn’t want to invest, advises Peyush Bansal

In the last few weeks, Abhijeet Bhattacharya has made it clear that he does not like his songs being credited as “Shah Rukh’s songs.” He also said that he was “hurt” by this and Shah Rukh was also aware of the same.
summary: During a recent *Indian Idol* episode, singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya shared how he suggested Shah Rukh Khan should sing the last line of the song “I Am The Best” for *Phir Bhi Dil Hai Hindustani*. However, composer Lalit Pandit, who was also on the show, corrected him, stating that it was Shah Rukh's own idea to record the line. Lalit recalled how Shah Rukh insisted on performing the final part after multiple takes from Abhijeet, eventually doing it in one go. Abhijeet seemed embarrassed by the correction, and there was a bit of playful banter between the two. Additionally, Abhijeet expressed his displeasure over his songs being credited solely to Shah Rukh Khan.

headline: Amitabh Bachchan on Bachchan family’s dining habits, why he always occupies chair facing north: ‘I don’t want long life at the cost of…’
article:
Actor Amitabh Bachchan is often seen sharing anecdotes from his illustrious career on Kaun Banega Crorepati (KBC) Season 16, but the latest episode flipped the script as contestant Kaushalendra Pratap Singh brought up a lesser-known story about the legendary actor. He recalled reading in a book by Amitabh’s father, Harivansh Rai Bachchan, about the actor braving contaminated water during the shoot of his 1979 film Kaala Patthar. Kaushalendra also spoke about the senior Bachchan’s heartfelt wish for his son’s long life.

Kaushalendra, who hails from Dhanbad, Jharkhand, and works in the coal-buying sector, referenced the Chasnala mining disaster that inspired Kaala Patthar. He shared, “I remember that you shot for Kaala Patthar after the Jharia Chasnala disaster. The disaster happened due to a dam burst, and during the shoot, contaminated water was sprayed on you to recreate the scene. I read that your health suffered because of it, but you continued shooting. This incident is well-known in our region. Your father, Harivansh Rai Bachchan, also mentioned it in his book.”



Amitabh acknowledged the anecdote with a nod. Kaala Patthar, produced and directed by Yash Chopra, was based on the 1975 Chasnala mining tragedy near Dhanbad, where 375 miners lost their lives.

Kaushalendra then shifted the conversation to a more personal note, recounting another story from Harivansh Rai Bachchan’s book about the Bachchan family’s dining habits. “He wrote about how your family always dines together and that you sit at the dining table facing North. He mentioned that sitting facing north brings truth, and he expressed that he himself sought truth while wishing you a long life. He wrote, ‘I need truth, but you (Amitabh) need ayush (a long life).’ He also wrote that when he expressed his desire to sit in your place, facing north, you told him, ‘I don’t want a long life at the cost of truth.’”

Amitabh confirmed the story and elaborated on the bond he shared with his father. “My father would always say that I should have a long life, and that was enough for him,” he said.
summary: In a recent episode of *Kaun Banega Crorepati* (KBC) Season 16, contestant Kaushalendra Pratap Singh shared a lesser-known story about Amitabh Bachchan, referencing his brave performance during the shoot of *Kaala Patthar* (1979), where he worked despite being exposed to contaminated water. Kaushalendra also mentioned Amitabh’s father, Harivansh Rai Bachchan, who wished for his son’s long life and always emphasized the importance of truth. Amitabh acknowledged the anecdotes and reflected on his close bond with his father.

headline: ‘Entire theatre clapped when Sanjay Kapoor slapped Madhuri Dixit in Raja,’ recalls Indra Kumar: ‘I thought my career was over when his first film flopped’
article:
Sanjay Kapoor marked his acting debut in 1995 with the film Prem. However, the film, also starring Tabu, failed at the box office. Although his next movie, Raja, was scheduled for release three weeks later, due to the poor performance of his debut film, many believed his career was over even before it started. Raja director Indra Kumar believed that his career as a filmmaker too was over, now that his film was going to flop due to Sanjay Kapoor. However, it turned out to be a huge success.

Recalling the incident, Indra Kumar, who had delivered two successful films before Raja, told Siddharth Kannan, “After giving two successful films, I reshot Raja. When I watched the original film, I quiet didn’t understand certain scenes. I realised my mistake, so I rewrote the script and shot it again. That picture too went on to become a super hit.”



Also Read | Lyricist Anantha Sriram criticises Prabhas’ Kalki 2898 AD for ‘portraying Karna as superior to Arjuna’: ‘Ashamed to be part of this industry’

He also added that things were not as smooth as they sound now. He shared, “Just three weeks before the release of Raja, another film of Sanjay Kapoor with Tabu (Prem) had released. But it flopped. People started making fun of me. Even I lost hope. In my mind, I thought, ‘Indra Kumar, consider this your last film. After this, let’s go to Haridwar.'” Explaining his state of mind, Indra Kumar who had just directed the third film of his career, shared, “Now my hero was Sanjay Kapoor, whose previous film flopped so everybody was talking about him. It could have had a bad impact on my film. I lost hope. But, thanks to my stars, and Madhuri Dixit, and Saroj Khan, and my writers, they all saved this film for me.”

Sharing his success moment, the filmmaker said, “When I was watching the movie in Novelty (theatre), the same people who were ridiculing Sanjay Kapoor for his previous film, were clapping for him on the scene where he slaps Madhuri Dixit.” The filmmaker smiled as he shared the incident. He proudly explained, “There is a scene where Madhuri Dixit accuses Sanjay Kapoor’s brother of harassing her, but he slaps her instead and takes his brother’s side. He refuses to believe her. The entire Novelty theatre was clapping. That’s how much power the script holds.”

ALSO READ | Diljit Dosanjh could have been at the Oscars, only if Amar Singh Chamkila actually got its due

The line that Indra Kumar was referring to in his quote was: “Khabardaar jo mere bhai ko pagal kaha aur rahi baat faisle ki toh sun, tujh jaisi 1000 ladkiyan mai qurbaan karta hu apne bhai pe. Samjhi? (Beware anyone who calls my brother mad, and as far as the decision is concerned, listen, I will sacrifice 1000 girls like you for my brother. Understood?)”

Indra Kumar was also a new filmmaker back then who marked his debut with the 1990 film Dil, followed by the 1992 film Beta. Both the films turned out to be commercial hits.

In the same interview, he talked about Sanjay Kapoor not becoming a successful actor. He shared, “Although the film was a great success, it didn’t work in favour of Sanjay Kapoor. I say this to my son too, ‘It doesn’t matter how good you are as an actor, it all depends on your fate and stars. There is a reason certain actors are termed stars. It is because their stars favour them and make them successful. Sanjay Kapoor’s stars were not as powerful. According to me, he did great in movies like Raja. But, it didn’t work for him.”

Sanjay Kapoor got into supporting roles within a decade of his acting career as most of his films flopped at the box office. Eventually, he turned towards production, followed by OTT shows and movies. He reunited with his Raja co-star Madhuri Dixit for the Netflix show, The Fame Game.
summary: Sanjay Kapoor's acting career faced a rocky start with the failure of his debut film *Prem* (1995), but his second film, *Raja* (1995), directed by Indra Kumar, turned out to be a huge success. Despite the setback from *Prem*, which led to doubts about both Sanjay Kapoor's and Indra Kumar's careers, *Raja* became a hit after Kumar reworked the script and reshot some scenes. The film featured a memorable moment where Sanjay Kapoor's character slaps Madhuri Dixit, earning applause from the audience. Despite *Raja*'s success, Sanjay Kapoor's career did not take off as expected, and he eventually transitioned to supporting roles and later production and OTT projects. Indra Kumar reflected that success in the film industry often depends on fate and stars, and despite Sanjay’s performance in *Raja*, his career did not reach the heights of some of his contemporaries.

headline: Gadkari says highways to be made safer via emergency braking, driver drowsiness alert, electronic stability controls
article:
Concerned about the rise in accidents on the highways, the ministry of road transport and highways (MoRTH) has proposed to make the installation of safety devices mandatory for all heavy vehicles.
Minister of road transport and highways Nitin Gadkari has said that MoRTH will soon finalise a draft notification for mandatory installation of Electronic Stability Control System, Emergency Braking System, and Driver Drowsiness Alert and Safety System on heavy commercial vehicles.
These systems will ensure better safety on highways as about 33,000 people out of 172,000 people (2023 data from MoRTH) have been killed on Indian roads by trucks as impacting vehicles.
Gadkari said that as part of its exercise to make roads safer, the ministry has also come out with a new  4,500 crore centrally funded scheme for setting up of driving training centres and automated testing clusters across the country.
There is shortage of 22 lakh skilled drivers in the country and through the policy, the government will ensure that properly trained drivers meet the requirement for the transport sector. The driver training centres would provide employment opportunity for about 50 lakh people. In two years about 1,250 such training and fitness centres would come up in different parts of the country, the minister said.
Health care scheme for accident victimsContinuing with its drive to ensure safety on roads and ensure proper care of road accident victims, MoRTH also proposes a nationwide launch of a health care scheme that will provide cashless treatment to road accident victims in the golden hour after an accident.
The scheme, which is being revised after launch of pilot in a few states over the last couple of years, will cover hospitalization expenses up to  1.5 lakh per accident per person. It will cover hospitalization for up to 7 days from date of the accident at all hospitals listed in the governments Ayushman Bharat scheme. Hit and run victims will get  2 lakh compensation.
During the two-day workshop, issues relating to Expediting operationalization of Registered Vehicle Scrapping Facilities (RVSFs) and Automated Testing Stations (ATSs) by states, and standardization of audit requirements and ratings of scrapping centres were also discussed. The meeting discussed pan-India adoption ofPUCC 2.0 or Pollution Under Control Certificate.Revised PUCC guidelines were presented to ensure that all states are onboarded on them at the earliest. It also discussed introduction ofBS-VII norms andtimelines for introduction of new norms, along with the expected reduction in pollution with the norms were also discussed.
summary: MoRTH will soon finalise a draft notification for mandatory installation of Electronic Stability Control System, Emergency Braking System, and Driver Drowsiness Alert and Safety System on heavy commercial vehicles. As part of its exercise to make roads safer, the government has also come out with a new scheme for setting up of driving training centres.

headline: Mohammed Shami fitness update: Ravi Shastri questions BCCI’s lack of communication on Indian pacer’s recovery
article:
Former India head coach Ravi Shastri has questioned the BCCI and National Cricket Academy (NCA) 's lack of communication on Mohammed Shami's recovery. The pacer, who last played for India in the final of the 2023 ODI World Cup, was out of action for nearly a year with an ankle injury before making a comeback in the domestic circuit in November last year.

Since his return, Shami has played in the Ranji Trophy, Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy and Vijay Hazare Trophy for Bengal and was rumoured to be flown to Australia to join the Indian squad for the final two Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests in Melbourne and Sydney.

But to everyone's surprise, Shami was officially ruled out of the final two BGT Tests, with the BCCI medical team citing a knee swelling. Unimpressed by how the BCCI medical team has handled Shami's injury, Shastri questioned why the India pacer is sitting so long at the NCA.“To be honest, I was very surprised with the communication going on in the media as to what exactly happened to Mohammed Shami,” Shastri stated in the ICC Review. “Where is he when it comes to recovery?”

“He's been sitting in the NCA for I don't know how long. Why can't proper communication come out on where he stands? A player of his ability, I would have brought him to Australia,” he added.
summary:
Former India head coach Ravi Shastri has expressed frustration over the lack of communication regarding Mohammed Shami's recovery, following the pacer's injury struggles. Shami, who last played for India during the 2023 ODI World Cup final, had been out of action for nearly a year due to an ankle injury. After returning to competitive cricket in November 2024 and playing in domestic tournaments like the Ranji Trophy and Vijay Hazare Trophy, there were speculations about his inclusion in the Indian squad for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy's final two Tests in Australia.

However, Shami was ruled out of the remaining BGT Tests due to knee swelling, with the BCCI medical team citing the issue. Shastri, who was surprised by the lack of clear communication on Shami's injury status, questioned the prolonged recovery period and the lack of updates on the pacer's condition. He suggested that a player of Shami's caliber should have been considered for a trip to Australia if fit and that better transparency was needed in handling the situation.

headline: 5 political trends to watch out for in 2025: Future of Sangh-BJP ties, women voters to the Priyanka Gandhi factor
article:

Political events view ladies as “labharthis (beneficiaries)” however even this has its limits.Girls are among the many few constituencies right now that lower throughout faith and caste affiliations. headline: WWE Raw Netflix debut: John Cena makes massive Royal Rumble announcement on farewell tour
article:
Sixteen-time world champion John Cena made a huge announcement on WWE Raw's debut on Netflix on Monday. Making his most-awaited return on WWE, Cena announced that he will be participating in the 30-man Royal Rumble match, which is scheduled to take place on February 1. A win in the Royal Rumble match will guarantee him a title clash at Wrestlemania 41.
If John Cena is eliminated during his Royal Rumble match, he will still have another chance to enter the main event at Wrestlemania. Then Cena has win the Elimination Chamber matches which will entitle him a title match at the Wrestlemania - the biggest show of the year.
With 16 world championship titles to his credit, Cena is tied with Ric Flair. One more title will put him at the top of the list as he will be come the undisputed WWE world champion. Among the active, full-time WWE stars, Randy Orton leads the charge with 14 titles. Roman Reigns and CM Punk follow Orton with six titles each.
During his appearance in the ring, Cena made a special mention for Netflix. Thank You, Netflix, for allowing the world to see the experience of Monday Night Raw, Cena said.
John Cena's possible Wrestlemania opponentWhile it is still unclear as to whom Cena might challenge at Wrestlemania 41, based on a Times Now report, he could face Cody. With Cody putting his title against Cena, it could help the former to elevate his stature in WWE.
As far as Gunther is concerned, the Austrian could defend his title against CM Punk or Seth Rollins. Another solid contender to win at Wrestlemania is Drew McIntyre. The Scot had defeated Rollins at Wrestlemania 40. However, he lost the title after five minutes as Damian Priest cashed in his Money in the Bank briefcase.
summary: John Cena will be participating in the 30-man Royal Rumble match on February 1. A win in the match will guarantee him a title clash at Wrestlemania 41. It is still unclear as to whom Cena might challenge at the show. He could face Cody, Seth Rollins, Drew McIntyre or Roman Reigns.

headline: Jasprit Bumrah nominated for Decembers ICC Player of the Month award; Pat Cummins, Dane Paterson on list
article:
India's star pacer Jasprit Bumrah was on Tuesday nominated for the ICC Mens Player of the Month award for December 2024 following his standout performance against Australia in the recently concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy, reported PTI.
Earlier in December, Bumrah picked up 22 wickets in the three Tests at a phenomenal average of 14.22. He finished the five-match Test series with 32 wickets in hand, even though he could not bowl in Australias second innings in Sydney because of a back spasm.
Bumrah's standout spells, including nine wickets in both the Brisbane and Melbourne Tests, kept India in the competition. He also won the Player of the Series award for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
In the first innings of the fifth Test against Australia in Sydney, Bumrah scored 22 off 17 balls, which is the highest score by an Indian captain in BT 2024-25.
This remarkable performance also earned Bumrah the highest rating points by any Indian bowler in the ICC Test Player Rankings.
Other players on the listAlong with Jasprit Bumrah, the second player who has been nominated for the prestigious award is Australian skipper Pat Cummins, who led his team to win the BGT series against India by 3-1. In the three Tests he played in December, Cummins claimed 17 wickets at an average of 17.64.
In addition to his bowling exploits, Cummins contributed with the bat and scored 49 and 41 in Melbourne. He also picked up 6 wickets in the match, helping Australia secure another important win.
The third player on the list is South African seamer Dane Paterson, who took 13 wickets in two Tests at an average of 16.92 and helped the Proteas seal a place against the Aussies in the World Test Championship final later this year.
His figures of 5/71 against Sri Lanka and 5/61 against Pakistan played a key role in South Africa's victories.
With agency inputs.
summary: Jasprit Bumrah nominated for ICC Mens Player of the Month award for December 2024. India's star pacer picked up 22 wickets in the three Tests at a phenomenal average of 14.22. Australian skipper Pat Cummins, who led his team to win the BGT series against India by 3-1, also nominated.

headline: Hyderabad Metro extension | CM directs officials to prepare DPRs for Future City, Shamirpet and Medchal routes by March end
article:
Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy held a meeting with senior officials to review Hyderabad Metro Rail extension and construction of elevated corridors. File | Photo Credit:

RAMAKRISHNA G

Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy directed the officials concerned to prepare comprehensive detailed project reports (DPRs) pertaining to extension of metro rail to Future City, Shamirpet and Medchal.

The officials were asked to complete the DPR's by March end and take steps to secure Central government's approval for them soon so that tenders could be invited before April-end. The Chief Minister gave the directions at a meeting with senior officials to review metro rail extension and construction of elevated corridors on Tuesday.
summary:
Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy has directed senior officials to prepare comprehensive Detailed Project Reports (DPRs) for the extension of the Hyderabad Metro Rail to Future City, Shamirpet, and Medchal.

At a review meeting on Tuesday, focused on the Metro Rail extension and construction of elevated corridors, the Chief Minister instructed that DPRs should be completed by the end of March 2025.

He further emphasized the need to secure approval from the Central government soon after the DPRs are finalized, with a target to invite tenders before the end of April 2025. These measures are part of the government’s efforts to expand Hyderabad’s infrastructure and improve urban connectivity.

headline: R&D loses relevance if it does not meet timelines, says Air Chief
article:
Research and Development loses relevance if it does not meet timelines, Indian Air Force (IAF) chief Air Chief Marshal (ACM) A.P. Singh said on Tuesday (January 7, 2025), pointing that the indigenous Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) was conceived in 1984 and today in 2025, they still do not have the first 40 aircraft. His comments come amid the crisis the IAF is facing, in terms of depleting fighter strength and huge delays in development and delivery of indigenous fighters.

"R&D loses its relevance in case it is not able to meet timelines.

Technology delayed is technology denied. There has to be an increased aptitude for acceptance of risks involved and failures in R&D. There is an amount of risk inherent to R&D - and we should cater to absorb it a certain degree. A greater leeway should be available to researchers, there may be failures - what is important is that we learn from them and move on," ACM Singh said while speaking at the 21st Subroto Mukerjee seminar organised by the Centre for Air Power Studies. "Atma Nirbharta will come at a cost and we should accept it - we may have to spend more and buy at a higher rate if required - amortising of the R&D part and limited numbers will push the cost up - but will give the much needed self-reliance.
summary:
Indian Air Force (IAF) chief Air Chief Marshal (ACM) A.P. Singh on Tuesday (January 7, 2025) stressed that Research and Development (R&D) loses its relevance if it does not meet timelines, citing the prolonged delay in the indigenous Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) project. Conceived in 1984, the LCA project has still not delivered the first 40 aircraft by 2025, which has contributed to the IAF’s depleting fighter strength.

Speaking at the 21st Subroto Mukerjee seminar organised by the Centre for Air Power Studies, ACM Singh remarked, “Technology delayed is technology denied.” He called for a greater tolerance for risks and failures in R&D, emphasizing that setbacks are part of the process and should be treated as learning opportunities.

He further highlighted that self-reliance (Atma Nirbharta) in defence manufacturing “will come at a cost”, including higher prices and limited production runs. However, he argued that these challenges are necessary investments for achieving long-term technological and strategic autonomy for India.

headline: ISRO delays key docking experiment, shares new video of cowpea seedlings sprouting leaves in space: WATCH
article:
The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) informed on Monday about the postponement of its crucial docking experiment in space. ISRO's SpaDeX satellites were scheduled to carry out the docking process on January 7.This has now been postponed to January 9.
ISRO said in a post on X on Monday, The SpaDeX Docking scheduled on (January) 7th is now postponed to 9th. The docking process requires further validation through ground simulations based on an abort scenario identified today.
"Docking" happens when a spacecraft can manoeuvre and attach to a space station by itself. Meanwhile, ISRO explains that in-space docking technology is useful when multiple rockets are launched into space to achieve common mission objectives.
If the SpaDex mission is accomplished, India will become the fourth country in the world to have space docking technology.
'Cowpea seeds sprout in space': A timelapse videoAhead of the docking experiment, ISRO achieved a significant breakthrough in space research with the successful germination of cowpea seeds in space.
The seeds, part of the Compact Research Module for Orbital Plant Studies (CROPS) experiment, sprouted within just four days of being sent into space aboard the PSLV-C60 mission.
ISRO shared on Tuesday a timelapse video of first "leaves emerging in space". It posted, "VSSC's CROPS (Compact Research Module for Orbital Plant Studies) experiment aboard PSLV-C60 captures the fascinating growth of cowpea in microgravity."

According to the ISRO, the Compact Research Module for Orbital Plant Studies (CROPS), developed by the Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre (VSSC), is an automated platform designed to cultivate and sustain plant life in the microgravity environment of space.
One of its recent experiments involved growing cowpea (Vigna unguiculata) seeds within a controlled, closed environment equipped with active thermal management, said ISRO. The space agency sent eight cowpea seeds as part of the experiment.
'India's first robotic arm operates in space'The ISRO successfully operated its first robotic arm in space, marking a significant milestone in the nation's space exploration endeavours. "...A proud #MakeInIndia milestone in space robotics," ISRO said on X.
The agency also demonstrated tethered debris capture in space using visual servoing, motion prediction, and a parallel end-effector for precise manipulation.
Another video shared by ISRO showed SpaDeXs Chaser satellite capturing its first video of Earth from space.
About SpaDeX missionISRO had successfully launched the ambitious Space Docking Experiment (SpaDeX) mission on December 30.
The PSLV C60 rocket carrying two small satellites, SDX01 (Chaser) and SDX02 (Target), along with 24 payloads, had lifted off from the first launchpad of the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota, and about 15 minutes after liftoff, the two small spacecraft weighing about 220 kg each were launched into a 475-km circular orbit as intended.
According to ISRO, SpaDeX mission is a cost-effective technology demonstrator mission for the demonstration of in-space docking using two small spacecraft that was launched by PSLV.
This technology is essential for India's space ambitions such as Indian on Moon, sample return from the Moon, the building and operation of Bharatiya Antariksh Station (BAS), etc. In-space docking technology is essential when multiple rocket launches are required to achieve common mission objectives.
summary: ISRO's SpaDeX satellites were scheduled to carry out the docking process on January 7. This has now been postponed to January 9. In-space docking technology is useful when multiple rockets are launched into space to achieve common mission objectives. If the SpaDex mission is accomplished, India will become the fourth country in the world to have space docking technology.

headline: TTD gears up to host over 7 lakh devotees during Vaikunta Ekadasi festival
article:
TTD Executive Officer J. Syamala Rao inspecting the arrangements being made for the Vaikunta Ekadasi festival, at Tirumala on Tuesday. | Photo Credit: Special Arrangement

The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) has made elaborate arrangements to facilitate the Vaikunta Dwara Darshan for more than 7 lakh devotees during the auspicious Vaikunta Ekadasi festivities, its Executive Officer J. Syamala Rao said on Tuesday.

Addressing the media, Mr. Rao said that the Vaikunta Dwaram, the innermost passage encircling the sanctum sanctorum of Lord Venkateswara temple, will be opened on January 10, the Vaikunta Ekadasi day, and remain accessible for the devotees for ten days.
summary:
TTD Executive Officer J. Syamala Rao inspected the ongoing preparations for the upcoming Vaikunta Ekadasi festival at Tirumala on Tuesday.

Speaking to the media, Mr. Rao said that elaborate arrangements have been made by Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) to provide Vaikunta Dwara Darshan for over 7 lakh devotees during the festivities.

The Vaikunta Dwaram, the sacred inner passage surrounding the sanctum sanctorum of the Lord Venkateswara temple, will be opened on January 10 and will remain open for 10 days, allowing pilgrims to have the special darshan.

headline: U.S. Inflation surges to 3% in January 2025—Highest since June: What’s driving the rise and its impact on your wallet
article:
Why did inflation increase in the US?

Live Events

Impact on the US economy and consumers

What’s next for US Inflation?

FAQs:







(You can now subscribe to our

(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channel

The U.S. Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased by 3% in January 2025 compared to the same month last year, slightly up from 2.9% in December 2024. This signals that inflation remains a concern for policymakers and consumers alike. The rise in prices is affecting daily expenses, from groceries to gas, making it crucial to understand what’s driving this trend and how it impacts the broader economy.Energy costs played a major role in pushing inflation higher, with gas and fuel prices accounting for 40% of the overall monthly increase. Rising global oil prices and supply chain disruptions have driven up costs.Essential food items such as meat and eggs remained expensive due to ongoing supply issues, including adverse weather conditions and disease outbreaks in livestock. Food inflation continues to put pressure on household budgets.The U.S. government has imposed new tariffs on imported goods, particularly from China, raising concerns about further inflation. These tariffs increase production costs for businesses, which then pass the burden onto consumers.The housing sector remains under pressure, with rental costs increasing by 5.2% year-over-year. Higher interest rates have slowed down new housing construction, leading to a supply-demand gap.The Federal Reserve had recently lowered its benchmark interest rate to 4.3%, aiming to balance economic growth and inflation control. However, with inflation still above the Fed’s 2% target, further rate cuts may be delayed.: The stock market responded negatively to the CPI data. Dow Jones Futures dropped by 425 points (1%), while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 fell by 1.1% and 1.2%, respectively. Investors are now uncertain about future monetary policies.With prices continuing to rise, consumers are cutting back on discretionary spending. Retail sales have shown slower growth, and many households are prioritizing essential goods over luxury purchases.Economists are closely watching upcoming economic data to gauge whether inflation will slow down in the coming months. The combination of higher energy costs, food prices, and new tariffs could keep inflation elevated for longer than expected. If inflation doesn’t ease, the Federal Reserve may have to reconsider its interest rate strategy to stabilize the economy.Due to higher energy prices, food costs, and new import tariffs.The Dow Jones fell 425 points, and S&P 500 and Nasdaq also declined.
summary:
US inflation, measured by the Consumer Price Index, rose to 3% in January 2025, up from 2.9% in December 2024, highlighting ongoing economic concerns. This increase is primarily driven by surging energy costs, particularly gas and fuel, which accounted for 40% of the monthly rise. Essential food items like meat and eggs remain expensive due to supply issues such as adverse weather. New government tariffs on imported goods, especially from China, are also contributing by raising production costs.

The housing sector continues to see pressure with rental costs up 5.2% year-over-year. Although the Federal Reserve recently lowered its benchmark interest rate, inflation remains above its 2% target, potentially delaying further cuts. The stock market reacted negatively, with major indices dropping, and consumers are reducing discretionary spending. Economists anticipate inflation could remain elevated, possibly prompting the Fed to reconsider its interest rate strategy to stabilize the economy.

headline: WWE Raw debut on Netflix: Why are Indian fans missing out on Monday night premiere event on OTT?
article:
World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) will enter a new era when it makes its Monday night debut on January 6. Having entertained fans for more than three decades, the WWE is making a major shift from television screens to the OTT platform for the very first time in history as the organisers aim to break into more audiences.

Without a doubt, WWE wants to make its Netflix debut in a grand way, as many legends are set to appear on the show. While The Rock has already confirmed to be on the show, legendary Hulk Hogan has also reportedly confirmed his participation. However, it will be John Cena's farewell tour.

Set to take place at the Intuit Dome in Los Angeles, the WWE Monday Night Raw promises to be an entertaining affair with several high-stake matches in the line-up. With Seth Rollins vs CM Punk in the main event highlighting the line-up, Roman Reigns faces the Solo Sikoa challenge in a one-on-one match. Logan Paul is also set for his WWE return.
summary: WWE is set to make a historic debut on Netflix with its Monday Night Raw on January 6, marking a shift from traditional television to OTT. The event, aimed at reaching a wider audience, will feature legendary appearances, including The Rock and Hulk Hogan, while John Cena bids farewell in his final tour. Held at the Intuit Dome in Los Angeles, the show promises high-stakes matches, with Seth Rollins taking on CM Punk in the main event. Roman Reigns will face Solo Sikoa in a one-on-one match, and Logan Paul is also set to return to WWE action.

headline: Champions Trophy 2025: British politicians want England to boycott clash against Afghanistan in Lahore; here’s why
article:
The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) has been asked to boycott their match against Afghanistan in the upcoming Champions Trophy in Pakistan, according to a letter signed by more than 160 politicians in the United Kingdom. In the letter, the politicians reasoned that the Taliban regime's assault on women's rights is the main agenda for their stand. England is scheduled to play Afghanistan in Lahore on February 26.

Since the Taliban's return to power in Afghanistan in 2021, female participation in sports has been effectively stopped, a move that directly puts the Afghanistan Cricket Board in contravention of International Cricket Council (ICC) rules.

Since the ICC has allowed the Afghanistan men's cricket team to play cricket, the UK parliament has written to the ECB to make its own moral objection.Penned by Labour MP Tonia Antoniazzi and signed by a cross-party group from the House of Commons and House of Lords, including Nigel Farage and Jeremy Corbyn, it raises the “insidious dystopia” unfolding in Afghanistan.

The statement, addressed to ECB chief executive Richard Gould, concludes: “We strongly urge the England men's team players and officials to speak out against the horrific treatment of women and girls in Afghanistan under the Taliban.

“We also urge the ECB to consider a boycott of the upcoming match against Afghanistan... to send a clear signal that such grotesque abuses will not be tolerated. 

“We must stand against sex apartheid, and we implore the ECB to deliver a firm message of solidarity and hope to Afghan women and girls that their suffering has not been overlooked,” it said.
summary: The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) has been urged by over 160 UK politicians to boycott their upcoming Champions Trophy match against Afghanistan, scheduled for February 26 in Lahore. The letter, signed by MPs and Lords, highlights the Taliban's suppression of women's rights, particularly in sports, since their return to power in 2021. This move by Afghanistan violates ICC regulations, which mandate gender equality in cricket. The letter calls on the ECB to take a moral stand against the Taliban's actions and show solidarity with Afghan women and girls by boycotting the match.

headline: WWE Raw Netflix debut: John Cena makes massive Royal Rumble announcement on farewell tour
article:
Sixteen-time world champion John Cena made a huge announcement on WWE Raw's debut on Netflix on Monday. Making his most-awaited return on WWE, Cena announced that he will be participating in the 30-man Royal Rumble match, which is scheduled to take place on February 1. A win in the Royal Rumble match will guarantee him a title clash at Wrestlemania 41.

If John Cena is eliminated during his Royal Rumble match, he will still have another chance to enter the main event at Wrestlemania. Then Cena has win the Elimination Chamber matches which will entitle him a title match at the Wrestlemania - the biggest show of the year.With 16 world championship titles to his credit, Cena is tied with Ric Flair. One more title will put him at the top of the list as he will be come the undisputed WWE world champion. Among the active, full-time WWE stars, Randy Orton leads the charge with 14 titles. Roman Reigns and CM Punk follow Orton with six titles each.
summary: John Cena announced his participation in the 30-man Royal Rumble match, set for February 1, during WWE Raw’s Netflix debut. A victory would earn him a title match at WrestleMania 41, furthering his pursuit of a record-breaking 17th world championship, which would surpass Ric Flair's record. Cena, currently tied with Flair at 16 titles, could also enter the main event if eliminated by winning the Elimination Chamber match. Among active WWE stars, Randy Orton leads with 14 titles, while Roman Reigns and CM Punk follow with six each. Cena’s return adds excitement to WWE's biggest event.
